name: A21
content: Petya* accepted a job in a neighboring country, hopeful at the possibility of a better life for herself and her friend Avi. Instead, she was trafficked in a shipping container to another country and forced into sex trafficking. Her story is one of millions, which is why this #GivingTuesday, we're asking you to join us in raising more awareness and funds in the fight against human trafficking than ever before by sharing her story. Over the next 24 hours, we want to see as many... people as possible raise awareness about human trafficking through sharing Petya’s story by hosting a Facebook Watch Party. When you host a watch party, you are not only raising awareness, but you are inviting your friends to make a difference with you. And this Giving Tuesday, we're excited to share that all donations given through our website will be DOUBLED up to $130,000!  Share the film, host a watch party, and join the fight against human trafficking by giving at A21.org/Restore. When you do, all donations given will be MATCHED for a limited time. Your gift will change lives.

name: A21
content: Are you passionate about advocacy, social media, administration, or business development? What about restoration, freedom, and justice? From Spain to Australia, Dallas to Sweden, we have volunteer opportunities around the globe. Our volunteers are world-changers that will show up to move the mission of freedom forward. Sound like you? Apply now at A21.org/Volunteer

name: A21
content: In 2020 alone, 18,478 minors have been reached with Prevention material. The reality is 1 out of 4 trafficking victims around the world are children. We know that prevention is a key to ending human trafficking. Children are the future of this world. We want to empower future generations with education about child rights, safe and unsafe migration, and human trafficking so that children have the tools they need to prevent exploitation before it happens. A21.org/Education

name: A21
content: #MyFreedomDay, started by the @CNN Freedom Project, is a day to empower students to fight against modern-day slavery. Learn more about how you can JOIN the movement TODAY— A21.org/MyFreedomDay.  The CNN Freedom Project interviewed our COO, @Philiphyldgaard about our work and the importance of awareness.  You will make a difference by raising your voice. We believe that together, we will abolish slavery everywhere, forever.

name: A21
content: Today, March 16th, 2021, a global movement is taking place. Freedom is being celebrated all over the world. This day is led by empowered students, leading the cry to end modern day slavery. Together, they are spreading awareness and championing freedom by recording personal videos of themselves, sharing what freedom means to them. You can make a difference by raising your voice on social media, too. Your voice matters and will reach people with awareness. Will you join the mo...vement TODAY? 1. Go online, sign the pledge— A21.org/MyFreedomDay 2. Record a video about what freedom means to you. 3. Post the video TODAY on your feed or stories with the hashtag #MyFreedomDay and tag us, @A21. The more people are aware of human trafficking, the more we can prevent it from happening in the first place. Let's celebrate freedom together!

name: A21
content: Education is essential to end human trafficking. Our Primary Prevention Program is the first child-centered resource of it's kind that aims to educate primary school-aged kids on key topics such as child rights, safe and unsafe migration, and human trafficking in a play-based format. This 3 session program is designed to empower children ages 6-12, to champion their young voices, and to teach them how to make informed decisions that protect themselves and others. These young people are the future of this world and we are committed to ending slavery for all generations. If you are a parent or educator, watch the PPP training videos and facilitate the program to equip children with potentially live-saving tools: A21.org/PPP

name: A21
content: #BREAKINGNEWS: Three children are free from human trafficking and sexual exploitation. Desperate for money, a young mother sold her baby to a broker. Another survivor was exploited for sex as a pre-teen while the other was nearly forced to marry her perpetrator. But today, we pause and celebrate each child’s safety and freedom. A21 welcomed these children into our care, where they were interviewed in a child-safe environment at our Child Advocacy Center and will be receiving the medical and psychological care they need to restore a life of hope. This is why we fight. This is why we press on. Thank you for your continued support.

name: A21
content: 13 years ago today, our Founders @nickcaine @christinecaine responded to the global human trafficking crisis by launching A21 to abolish injustice in the 21st century, and today, we’re celebrating our 13th birthday in a life-changing way. We’re so grateful for every single person who has been a part of this remarkable journey. In honor of our birthday, some generous supporters have created a special match—the first 200 people who sign up to become a Freedom Sponsor will have ...their monthly gift matched for their entire first year! Will you celebrate A21's birthday by doubling your impact for the next 12 months by joining the Freedom Sponsor community? Your monthly donation will help us reach, rescue, and restore more men, women, and children to a life of freedom. Thank you for your commitment and generosity. The best is yet to come. We won't stop until the world is free, and we couldn’t do this without you.

name: A21
content: Freedom is a basic human right. That's why we are committed to fighting for the freedom of women all over the world. Because of your support, we have seen renewed dreams, restoration, freedom, and independence for survivors in our care. Each life that is changed is bringing us closer to seeing a world that is free become a reality. Your gift today can make a difference in the life of a survivor: A21.org/Donate #InternationalWomensDay #IWD2021

name: A21
content: Liberty scarves began in 2014 when a survivor shared that she could knit in hopes of starting a career for herself. Liberty is our social enterprise–employing survivors of human trafficking as they step into a life of freedom and independence. As we approach International Women’s Day tomorrow, we want to invite you to invest in the valuable lives of women. Join the story of freedom by purchasing a scarf. Get yours today: A21.org/Liberty

name: A21
content: Interested in volunteering with A21? We are looking for passionate people, committed to seeing lives restored and freedom for all. Share your skills and talents to make a difference. Your work can be a part of building a collective force for justice and freedom that changes the face of human trafficking in our world. Apply today at A21.org/Volunteer

name: A21
content: Take a stand for healing, hope, and freedom. We believe every human being deserves these rights. We are committed to fighting until we see this in our world. You can shop for a cause and advocate for freedom and restoration for survivors of human trafficking. Your purchase goes towards real survivors in our A21 Aftercare Programs. We have a special offer TODAY while supplies last! Buy the journal + pen set, get 4 stickers FREE and our hoodies are RESTOCKED. Freedom starts with you, shop with purpose: A21.org/Shop

name: A21
content: While anyone can be a victim of forced labor, individuals with increased vulnerability due to financial stress or their unique position in society are often at risk. This may include migrants, refugees, marginalized groups, people with disabilities or financial insecurities, and children.⁠ ⁠ Educate yourself, learn how to protect others, and prevent exploitation before it happens by downloading our free Safe Employment Guide at A21.org/Education. Together, we will continue to fight for freedom–until every life is free.

name: A21
content: We're so excited to announce a new project we've been working on...a PODCAST! We are officially releasing the first few episodes of our new podcast–On The Frontlines. A podcast where we take the conversation to the frontlines of the fight of human trafficking–equipping you to make a difference, right where you are. We will speak with those in the trenches, spreading prevention to those most at risk, training frontline professionals to identify and free victims, and to those who provide direct care to survivors of trafficking as well from survivor leaders themselves. Why? Because you need to hear the whole story, know the facts, and stay up to date so we together can be better equipped to make a difference. Stream this podcast everywhere where podcasts are available.

name: A21
content: Today and everyday, we are in it to #ENDIT. Over the last 13 years, together we have seen millions reached and thousands identified, supported, and restored across the globe. Today, we raise our voices with our friends @enditmovement to shine a light on #slavery. We truly believe that together we can abolish it everywhere, forever. #enditmovement ❌

name: A21
content: Meet Anna. Her story is one of many. She was recruited by what is known as the Loverboy Tactic. Lured into trafficking under the pretenses of a romantic relationship, she is now in the care of A21 after bravely escaping. Because of your support, Anna is now able to receive the care she needs and deserves. Because of you, lives just like Anna's are being changed all over the world.

name: A21
content: Because restoration and freedom look different for every individual, so does our Aftercare Program. The journey of restoration is about the possibility of a changed story. We walk alongside survivors to see that possibility become a reality. Every individual matters and their story is still being written. Help survivors of human trafficking dream new dreams today. Your gift will make a difference in another life: A21.org/Give

name: A21
content: #BREAKINGNEWS: The U.S. team welcomed four new survivors into our Aftercare program this month. Three of the survivors share similar stories–falling in love only to be deceived and exploited for sex by the one they trusted. The fourth survivor came to America to pursue a better life. However, the job he was promised was a lie, and the dream he once had turned into a nightmare. But today, we pause in gratitude and celebration. All four survivors are free and receiving accommodation, psychological care, and support to restore their future. This is why we fight. This is why we press on. Because freedom is possible - when we all do our part. When you give, dreams are restored.

name: A21
content: It has never been more important to be equipped with education when it comes to human trafficking. Why? Because it is happening TODAY, right now, all around the world. ⁠ ⁠ Today we are highlighting a common tactic used to coerce people into human trafficking known as the 'Loverboy Tactic.' This is when men, often much older, pretend to be a loving boyfriend, luring vulnerable victims into trafficking under the pretenses of a romantic relationship. It is growing increasingly more common as a recruitment method and we believe that awareness is the key to prevention. ⁠ ⁠ Help protect and care for the young people in your community, join the fight: A21.org

name: AnnieCannons
content: #stopasianhate

name: AnnieCannons
content: For #WomensHistoryMonth, we honor inspiring women. Mary Church Terrell championed civil and women’s rights and built institutions that changed the nation.  A daughter of formerly enslaved people, Terrell campaigned tirelessly against discrimination and was a founder of the NAACP.  At age 86, Terrell successfully fought against segregation in public places, leading to a landmark SCOTUS decision.  Source:  National Women’s History Museum https://buff.ly/2C2Fdpo

name: AnnieCannons
content: Be inspired by AnnieCannons’ Co-founder and CTO Laura Hackney, as she discusses increasing economic empowerment for women. Organized by the Kota Alliance, this event is part of the NGO Committee on the Status of Women Forum, which advocates for gender equality.  Register here: http://bit.ly/3bPybGY #NGOs #nonprofits #socialimpact #diversity #womenbusinessowners #women #inclusion #womeninbusiness #genderequity #socialenterprise #femaleempowerment

name: AnnieCannons
content: Human trafficking is happening all around us. Yet, it doesn’t happen in a vacuum. It is the end result of a range of other persistent injustices and inequities in our society and our economy that disproportionately victimize people of color, indigenous communities, immigrants, and people who identify as LGBTQ+. To fight human trafficking means to fight racism, uphold LGBTQ+ equality, provide safe and affordable housing, and protect workers' rights.  #humantrafficking #traffic...kingawareness #endracism #LGBQTequality #housingjustice #workersrights Source: Polaris http://bit.ly/2NeX4SY

name: AnnieCannons
content: Fight human trafficking and gender-based violence while you build your company’s software. Contact AnnieCannons and we’ll tell you how.  #letstalk #softwareservices #webapp #mobileapp #websitedev

name: AnnieCannons
content: Today, March 8th, is #InternationalWomensDay, a global day that celebrates the achievements of women and our continued fight for women’s equality worldwide. We proudly raise our hands 🙌🏿 🙌🏾 🙌🏽 🙌🏻  to challenge inequality, call out bias and forge an inclusive world.  A challenged world is an alert world. And from challenge comes change. #ChooseToChallenge #IWD #EmpowerWomen #GenderEquality

name: AnnieCannons
content: Freedom from human trafficking is just the beginning of a survivor’s journey.  At AnnieCannons, we enable survivors to achieve economic independence through software training and work in our development shop. We strive to provide a trauma-informed work environment that allows survivors to take care of themselves and their families.  In the past 12 months, trainees and graduates at AnnieCannons have earned more than $521,000 for themselves and their families through work in ou...r dev shop.  #endhumantrafficking #humantraffickingpreventionmonth #humantraffickingawareness #humantrafficking #endtrafficking #stoptrafficking #antitrafficking #supportsurvivors

name: AnnieCannons
content: March is #WomensHistoryMonth and we are celebrating the voices, talents, and contributions of ground-breaking women, and women breaking ground, all month long! We start with highlighting our namesake, Annie Jump Cannon, a trailblazer for women in science, and our two women co-founders, Laura Hackney and Jessica Hubley, who channeled Annie’s legacy to uplift women’s voices through technology.  #WomensHistoryMonth #WomeninTech #EmpowerWomen #WomenEmpowered

name: AnnieCannons
content: In honor of #BHM, we celebrate Dr. Willie Hobbs Moore, the first Black woman to earn a Ph.D in physics. The author of more than 30 technical papers, Dr. Moore worked both in academia and industry.  She helped pave the way for BIPOC in both her accomplishments in physics as well as her activism in STEM education for minorities. #trailblazer #womeninstem Source: Ann Arbor District Library & Wikipedia

name: AnnieCannons
content: Today we recognize the brilliant Patricia Bath, an ophthalmologist, inventor, humanitarian, and scholar. Patricia Bath discovered and invented a new device and technique for cataract surgery known as laserphaco. Among her many firsts, Dr. Bath was the first woman to chair an ophthalmology residency program in the United States. In 1977, she founded the non-profit American Institute for the Prevention of Blindness, whose mission is to protect, preserve, and restore the gift of... sight.  In honor of Black History Month, we are spotlighting Black scientists who helped build our modern world and did not receive the credit they deserved. Thank you Dr. Patricia Bath for your contributions.  https://buff.ly/2Fqi83w #womeninstem #blackhistorymonth

name: AnnieCannons
content: We recognize Professor Alice Ball, a chemist who developed the most effective treatment for leprosy during the early 20th century. She was the first woman and African American to receive a masters degree and become a chemistry professor at the University of Hawaii. She was not recognized for her work until six years after her death, when she was briefly mentioned in a medical journal for the Ball Method (her leprosy treatment), which was the most effective treatment for the n...ext thirty years and was not replaced until the 1940s when a cure was found.  In honor of Black History Month, we are spotlighting Black scientists who helped build our modern world and did not receive the credit they deserved. Source: scientificwomen.net #hiddenfigures #BHM #chemistry #innovation

name: AnnieCannons
content: Meet Dr. Bettye Washington Greene. She earned her Ph.D. in Physical Chemistry from @waynestate and was the first female, Black chemist to work at the Dow Chemical Company @dow_official. She holds numerous patents for her work in polymer and latex development and was a charter member of the Midland, Michigan Alumni Chapter of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, a national public service group that focuses on Black women.  In honor of Black History Month, we are recognizing Black scien...tists who helped build our modern world and did not receive the credit they deserved. Source: Science History Institute  #hiddenfigures #BHM #bettyewashingtongreene #chemistry #innovation

name: AnnieCannons
content: In honor of Black History Month, we recognize Katherine Johnson, the famed NASA mathematician. The S.S. Katherine Johnson spacecraft was recently named after her and will fly to the International Space Station later this month. Johnson’s many accomplishments include plotting the calculations for the successful flight of the first American in space in 1961. She calculated the trajectory that put Apollo 11 on the moon in 1969. Her story has been immortalized in the Oscar-nomina...ted film, Hidden Figures. As Northrop Grumman Corporation put it, “Her work at NASA quite literally launched Americans into space.” Source: Yahoo and https://buff.ly/A8JOZD #hiddenfigures #BHM #katherinejohnson #NASA #space

name: AnnieCannons
content: We have been featured in an incredible piece written by Amy Rahe of The Freedom Fund highlighting what survivors want and need to sustain their freedom: unconstrained choice.  In this article, Rahe highlights the importance of organizations "implementing models based on listening to and learning from survivors, so that they can continue to support their long-term freedom." The perspectives of survivors must steer the priorities of the anti-trafficking movement. Economic empow...erment is high on this list.  You can find the full article, “How to Ensure Survivors of Modern Slavery Stay Free” here: https://buff.ly/3rwiXvq  #humantrafficking #endtrafficking #stoptrafficking #stayfree #antitrafficking #supportsurvivors

name: AnnieCannons
content: Thank you to Cisco for featuring AnnieCannons in their 2020 CSR Impact Report. With the help of partners like CISCO, we have been able to generate a 2.7x increase in total year-over-year income for AnnieCannons graduates. https://buff.ly/3jnK5d7 #ciscocsr #humantrafficking #genderbasedviolence #supportsurvivors #graduates #economicempowerment

name: AnnieCannons
content: While eradicating #humantrafficking seems daunting, at AnnieCannons we believe it is possible. But we can’t do it without your help. Here’s what you can do today and every day to help end human trafficking and support survivors.  #endhumantrafficking #humantraffickingpreventionmonth #humantraffickingawareness #humantrafficking #endtrafficking #stoptrafficking #antitrafficking #supportsurvivors

name: AnnieCannons
content: Sex trafficking is the crime of transporting victims by coercion, threat, or fraud to induce another individual to sell sex. Labor trafficking is the crime of transporting victims by coercion, threat, or fraud to perform labor services. Our diagram above only scratches the surface of where trafficking might appear in your community. Learn more by following us. #humantraffickingpreventionmonth #endsextrafficking #endlabortrafficking #endhumantrafficking #humantraffickingawareness #education #antitrafficking #supportsurvivors

name: AnnieCannons
content: Without economic opportunity & independence, survivors remain vulnerable to exploitation. Many survivors return to their trafficker or are re-exploited because they do not have the financial security and support structures to permanently break the cycle. Providing economic opportunity to survivors is key to ending the cycle for good.  We partner with organizations like @Cisco to work towards this end. Check out their blog post from last January to learn more about our partner...ship and how we work to provide real economic opportunity to survivors. 👇🏼👇🏼 https://buff.ly/3oMV2Hd #endhumantrafficking #humantraffickingpreventionmonth #humantraffickingawareness #humantrafficking #endtrafficking #stoptrafficking #antitrafficking

name: AnnieCannons
content: As an individual consumer, you have purchasing power that you can use to fight trafficking.  🌱 CHOOSING TO SHOP FAIR TRADE means taking a stance against forced labor and child labor. If a product has a Fair Trade Certified seal, that means it was made according to rigorous social, environmental, and economic standards. The companies and suppliers have committed to sustainable livelihoods and opportunity for their employees. 🌱 EDUCATE YOURSELF about the practices of companies ...you use and love. 🌱 SUPPORT COMPANIES with good practices. 🌱 PUT PRESSURE ON COMPANIES that use forced labor in their supply chains. Source: KQED #humantraffickingpreventionmonth #fairtrade #maketradefair #consciousconsumer #endhumantrafficking #humantraffickingawareness #antitrafficking

name: California Against Slavery
content: Please join this important session presented by World Without Exploitation.   Let's start the discussion.

name: California Against Slavery
content: Great resources from Rebecca Bender Initiative... check it out and share.

name: California Against Slavery
content: January is Human Trafficking Awareness Month.  Watch another great free webinar to deepen your understanding and expand your vision.

name: California Against Slavery
content: Call to action! Join the National Center on Sexual Exploitation and contact your members of Congress to Investigate Pornhub and #ShutItDown. Click on the post below to learn more.

name: California Against Slavery
content: How can you help put an end to the processing of payments for the exploitative porn industry? Contact your credit and debit card executives. Click on the post below to learn more.

name: California Against Slavery
content: New York Times cover piece, “The Children of Pornhub,” written by Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Nicholas Kristof, has further exposed the realities of exploitation found within PornHub.  This in-depth piece sheds light on the #Traffickinghub campaign and sparked even more action in the movement. Direct link to the article: https://www.nytimes.com/…/su…/pornhub-rape-trafficking.html…

name: California Against Slavery
content: Don't miss out on World Without Exploitation's final webinar of 2020. Tune in tomorrow morning and check out the post below to register!

name: California Against Slavery
content: Friends, Before you get to Giving Tuesday, I’d like to suggest a Make a Difference Monday!  One that doesn’t cost you a cent today, but can make a world of difference to a survivor a day in the future. The Safe Night App gives you the opportunity to provide a hotel night for a survivor when shelter is not immediately available.  You sign up today and designate the organization you want to support.  Then only when a temporary hotel stay is needed, you receive an alert for the ...amount of that hotel stay.   If you are able to help, you put in your payment info, the request is closed, the survivor is safely sheltered for another night.  Designated funds specifically for that survivor’s immediate need.  California Against Slavery partners with multiple agencies/organizations in helping to fund these temporary stays.  Just recently we received a call for help to fund a short stay for a survivor as she was being assessed for acceptance into a local shelter.  The shelter staff provides care. We were able to help provide temporary shelter. With your help, we can do more!  CAS is looking for 50 Safe Night App donors. Please join us because everyone deserves a violence free night.  Grateful to partner with you, Ginger Shaw, Executive Director We welcome guest submissions.  Send your 500-1,000 word post for consideration to info@californiaagainstslavery.org with the subject line: “Blog Submission“

name: California Against Slavery
content: Survivors and victims of the sex trade deserve to be protected. Their exploiters DON’T. The #EqualityModel decriminalizes those in the sex trade but holds accountable the pimps, buyers, and brothel-owners for the harm they cause. #SurvivorsAgenda say no to full decrim. Check out the WorldWE response to #SurvivorsAgenda call for full decriminalization of the sex trade on thier platform, excluded the voices of sexual exploitation survivors. https://medium.com/…/world-without-exploitation-response-to…

name: California Against Slavery
content: Check out the Unstranger Danger Documentary. "Unstranger Danger is an interview-style documentary created by a Southern California child abuse detective, whose goals are to educate and encourage children and families with a more comprehensive approach to child sexual abuse using the Four Core Pillars: Prevention, Investigation, Prosecution and Restoration." https://youtu.be/zgmePbDptwU Visit unstrangerdanger.com for more information.

name: California Against Slavery
content: Want to make an impact this advent season? Join us by participating in Dressember or adopt an Advent Calendar with your friends and community to assist survivor service organizations. Check out the post below to learn more!

name: California Against Slavery
content: Don't miss out on the next webinar in World Without Exploitation's Now & Next Online Speaker Series! Tune in tomorrow morning at 9 am (PST).

name: California Against Slavery
content: Our SoCal Safe Shelter Collaborative partner, Alabaster Jar Project is hosting a fundraiser this Saturday, Nov. 14th.  Great organization to support.

name: California Against Slavery
content: Domestic violence survivors and other abuse victims will no longer have to spend hours or days trying to find safe shelter under a new program that can locate available space within minutes. Check out the San Diego DA's press release to learn more: bit.ly/2GMBlxO

name: California Against Slavery
content: Check out the WorldWE response to #SurvivorsAgenda call for full decriminalization of the sex trade on their platform, excluded the voices of sexual exploitation survivors. #WhoseAgendaIsThis  https://medium.com/…/world-without-exploitation-response-to…

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: 2020 has been Cast’s most challenging year yet. By September 2020, Cast had responded to 185% more urgent human trafficking cases than last year. Right now the pandemic is forcing #humantrafficking survivors into crisis. They need our help.  Join us this giving season by making a life-changing donation that will empower human trafficking survivors with a new start. https://bit.ly/2W38V7m

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: We’re celebrating #WomensHistoryMonth all month long and turning our spotlight on Holly J. Mitchell. Los Angeles County Supervisor, Holly J.  Mitchell, has been a long-standing champion of the anti-trafficking movement. During her tenure as Senator of the 30th district, Supervisor Mitchell introduced SB 1322, to decriminalize prostitution charges for minors. This legislation requires law enforcement to ensure child victims of sex-trafficking are eligible for treatment rather than prosecution. “Stop the exploiters and help the exploited,” declared Supervisor Mitchell. Thank you for your work, Holly J. Mitchell!

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: On March 16th, a 21-year-old white man killed eight human beings, six of whom were Asian women. We are heartbroken for the families of the victims and outraged by these increasing acts of violence targeting Asian American Pacific Islander (AAPI) communities. Racism, misogyny, and xenophobia are urgent public health issues that we must act upon as a community with shared values and a vision to end hate. Injustice has no place in our community, or the world, and we stand with our AAPI partners and survivors in full solidarity. There is no time to waste. We urge you to support anti-hate legislation and seek resources for healing and health. Read our full statement here: https://bit.ly/2OMUjJ5

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: As economic conditions worsen due to COVID-19, human trafficking victims are currently facing increasingly unsafe, harsh, and exploitive conditions. Learn more about Cast’s budget request that would secure $10 million to help #StopTraffickingInItsTracks: https://bit.ly/2O2fXIW

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: Turning our #WomensHistoryMonth spotlight on Bonnie Abaunza. Bonnie Abaunza has dedicated her life to advancing human rights and social justice. As Founder and President of Abaunza Group, Bonnie mobilizes filmmakers and artists to address hard-hitting issues including human trafficking. Bonnie has worked on over 40 campaigns that have been nominated for acclaimed awards, including Oscar, Golden Globe, and Emmy Awards – from Hotel Rwanda, Blood Diamond, and The Promise, to Dia...ne Warren and Lady Gaga’s campaign for the song Til It Happens to You. Bonnie served as Vice President of Social Action and Advocacy at Participant Media and Director of Artists for Amnesty International Bonnie is the recipient of the 2019 Catholics in Media Social Justice Award and a Board member of the ACLU Foundation of Southern California.  To our #WCW, Bonnie, thank you for supporting Cast and the #humantrafficking movement.

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: Happy #InternationalWomensDay! We had the privilege to join a panel discussion with some pretty incredible women to discuss the role of women on the frontlines, and the important role women have played in fighting for justice and human rights. Watch tonight at 4:00 PT / 7:00 ET at the link below! Francesco premieres 3/28 on Discovery. https://www.facebook.com/PopeFrancisMovie/videos/484398766276116

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: Historically, the most identified victims of #humantrafficking are women and girls. At Cast, 81% of survivors identify as female. This #InternaltionalWomensDay we are bringing awareness to all of the resilient women and girl survivors at Cast and celebrating their journeys to freedom. Help us continue our life-transforming services for survivors by making a donation today. https://bit.ly/3sXdfn5

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: #WCW This week we are shining a light on the Catholic sisters who are taking lead to bring awareness to #humantrafficking, both domestically and abroad. As the anti-trafficking movement has grown, Catholic sisters have faithfully led the way. Thank you for your support and believing in our mission US Catholic Sisters Against Human Trafficking and Conrad N. Hilton Foundation. Find out more: https://bit.ly/3e37qAg

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: As economic conditions worsen due to COVID-19, human trafficking victims are currently facing increasingly unsafe, harsh, and exploitive conditions. Throughout the state, human trafficking services are being strained and the need for specialized services has dramatically increased. Learn more about Cast’s budget request that would secure $10 million to help #StopTraffickingInItsTracks: bit.ly/2O2fXIW

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: March is #WomensHistoryMonth! As we continue to witness some of the most historical moments in time, we celebrate and honor all of the women who are breaking boundaries, facing status quos head-on, and putting zero limits on themselves to stand up for our communities. In recognition of #WomensHistoryMonth, we are taking a special moment to celebrate trailblazing women that are taking the lead in advocating for human rights and survivors of human trafficking. 💪 Tag the women that inspire you in a comment below.

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: - As economic conditions worsen due to #COVID19, #HumanTrafficking victims are currently facing increasingly unsafe, harsh, and exploitive conditions. Thank you for your strong support and signing onto the budget request that would secure $10 million to help #StopTraffickingInItsTracks.

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking
content: Thank you Assemblymember Miguel Santiago and  Ash Kalra for leading the sign-on for the one-time $10 million budget request to assist in supporting victims of #HumanTrafficking during #COVID19. #ItEndsWithUs #StopTraffickingInItsTracks

name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking

name: Coalition Against Trafficking in Women (CATW)
content: We're deeply saddened by the tragedy in Atlanta this week. And we see the deep connections to the intersections of misogyny and racism AAPI women face daily, including sexualization, objectification, exoticization and fetishization, which this NY Times article highlights (and an incredible panelist on our At the Edge of the Margins virtual round table on the role of the media in normalizing prostitution spotlighted as well https://bit.ly/2NER06s). It was #femicide of mostly A...sian women and women of Asian descent by a white man who viewed them as sexual objects who "tempted" him.  While the facts are still becoming clear, there is evidence presenting itself to show how the sex trade system played a part and we need to talk about that too. Reports have been surfacing that signal this man was a sex buyer who had sought to purchase prostitution at "massage parlors," including at two of the establishments he later targeted. Let's remember that men who purchase prostitution feed the sex trade and fuel sex trafficking. They are an essential pillar of the sex trade system. There are also indications that he was a consumer of porn, which, as we've discussed many times, normalizes violence against women and trades in racialized and sexualized objectification of women.  And there's more. This The Boston Globe column looks at how women in illicit "massage parlors" are viewed by those who seek to purchase them: https://bit.ly/3f55VBU. "Prostitution is an industry that markets and brands Asian women. It has a real investment in cheapening racism and increasing sexism," Suzanne Jay of Asian Women for Equality said in a recent interview that also highlighted how "Asian women are over-represented in prostitution, particularly in storefront establishments like massage parlours." In a press release (https://bit.ly/3lEsFdp), we urge the City of #Atlanta to look into potential #sextrafficking and prostitution at these establishments and the sex trade connections we highlight as it investigates this tragedy and hate crime against women of color. Those killed deserve justice. And AAPI women deserve more than to be sexualized, objectified, exoticized and fetishized — racist, misogynist ideas the sex trade system promotes and on which it capitalizes.

name: Coalition Against Trafficking in Women (CATW)
content: "... women from all walks of life demanding safety from male violence — and demanding that the police, the government and men collectively be the ones to bear the burden of ensuring it." Male violence against women in the public and private spheres — in the home, in the streets, at a club, at the office, and, yes, in the sex trade — is committed by men. Women need more than platitudes, we need action and investments to #EndVAWG. We need to not be dismissed by the state when we raise our voices to demand better systems that will ensure our safety and remove the burden from us, #accountability and an end to impunity. RIP #SarahEverard #EndVAW #CSW65

name: Coalition Against Trafficking in Women (CATW)
content: Vital conversation with Comfort Women Action for Redress and Education about the controversial Harvard paper on "comfort women." The paper has seen a groundswell of criticism, including across academic disciplines for failing to meet basic standards of academic integrity. The conversation with CARE and allies emphasizes the need to refute denialism and pursue redress and education.  The Japanese government must accept historical responsibility for state-sanctioned #humantrafficking during WWII and offer an unequivocal apology per the demands of survivors. We can't forget them and we can't forget history. #JusticeForComfortWomen #ListenToSurvivors

name: Coalition Against Trafficking in Women (CATW)
content: #InternationalWomensDay serves as a time to celebrate those who have fought for the rights of women and girls before us, as well as a reminder that there is still work to be done to achieve our collective goal of #equality for all women and girls. For every 10 #humantrafficking victims identified, about 5 are women and 2 are girls, while 92% of detected sex trafficking victims are women and girls (UNODC). And the COVID-19 pandemic has only worsened women's and girls' vulnerab...ilities, which traffickers won't hesitate to use in order to exploit. While we celebrate #IWD2021, every day is international women's day at CATW. And we won't stop until we ensure that no woman or girl is bought or sold. Living free from violence and discrimination is a fundamental human right. #ChooseToChallenge

They need to really look at themselves in the mirror, because they’re prioritizing money and content over actual human beings’ lives.” And this is how MindGeek, Pornhub's parent company, responded to this brave survivor's testimony: https://bit.ly/3uruRJn  #ListenToSurvivors #TraffickingHub #Accountability #EndImpunity

name: Chains Interrupted
content: As you can imagine, fighting human trafficking is not something you simply do, but something you're so passionate about there has to be an intrinsic motivation/reason that causes you to do this.  The rewards are small and it's not easy.  We've been asking volunteers, member board and staff...what's your why?  This is Co-Founder Lenchen Raeside's why. in 1987 Bob and I started our non-profit work together. I have always had a heart for women and children and particularly towar...ds those who find themselves suffering and in need. I served in a volunteer capacity as Executive Director for Birthright of Cedar Rapids from 1987-1997. In 2001 we helped start The House of Hope where we housed and helped woman who had experienced horrific trauma in many cases. As Executive Director there, I helped develop the curriculum and program that involved whole health and healing; body, soul, spirit. While serving there, I began to receive calls from people around the country with stories of women and children who had been victimized by the heinous crime and evil of human sex trafficking. In 2013 we started Cedar Rapids Gives which would later turn into Chains Interrupted. In an interview recently, someone asked me why I continue to do what I do. (They asked me because Bob and are at retirement age)  My answer, simply, “Because I can not not do it”.

name: Chains Interrupted
content: Chainbreaker Champion - Sharon Kayser Chains Interrupted would not be the powerful force that it is, fighting Human Trafficking in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, and the world, if it weren’t for the many partners who have come alongside us.   Our March Chainbreaker Champion is Sharon Kayser, volunteer extraordinaire.  Sharon helps Chains Interrupted primarily through fundraising, helping wherever she can and most importantly raising awareness about human trafficking.  We are grateful fo...r Sharon and her passion to help us! When and how did you first hear about Chains Interrupted? “Another nonprofit that I help with called Bash CR wanted to donate their profits from their event to CI, so Tish came over and spoke about your organization and all of your wonderful help, helped us at our events.” What about your own personal story compelled you to want to get involved? “Fell in love with your goals and Tish! So, I have been helping ever since!” What do you do with CI? “I take in donations and sell them on FB, our annual garage sale in Center Point, Stuff Etc and Elegant Repeats. Plus volunteer at your different events!” What most surprised you about human trafficking?  “The fact that you almost have to know someone who is doing this horrible act because of the sheer volume. Also, the youngest victim in IA (18 months)!!!” What would you like people to know about trafficking?  “With this Covid right now the numbers are increasing significantly!” Is there anything people might be surprised to know about you that you would like to share? I am an open book so, not really. LOL”

name: Children's Rescue Initiative
content: To the Champions, the Warriors, the Abolitionists……...A Call to War Holding a picture in my hand of a rescued slave girl, looking at the slight smile and gleam in her eyes, I am overwhelmed. One minute she was the property of someone and then in a ninety-second raid, she was freed. I was there, taking her hand as my team secured the area. We moved as one and extracted three tiny broken vessels and in a moment we were gone, taking them to a new home, a new life.  I am speaking... to those who are rescuers and to those who will answer the call.  The business that we are in, that of rescuing humans from the tyranny of enslavement, is one with a myriad of enemies. There are human elements who want nothing more than to stop us, hurt us, or destroy us. We are stealing their products, livelihood, and futures.  Right now as you read this, countless children are being abused in every way invented. Just like the 90-year-old slave woman I rescued who dreamed everyday of freedom, there are multitudes of children dreaming the same dream. Forty million people around the globe are dreaming this dream. We are warriors of a righteous cause, men and women who must rise to the level of excellence to storm the dark arenas of evil. Once this mission is anchored in your heart, there is no turning back. However, the cause of abolition comes with a price; that of ceasing to live for self and sacrificing the comforts and security of safe living.  You must deny your own self dreams to become a rescuer of those who dream of being free.  It is incomprehensible to healthy-minded humans to realize that countless men and woman have descended into the darkness of harming children, of using them, of destroying them. Those of us who value a moral code and a champion’s heart can do nothing but fight for the helpless victims of malevolent-hearted humans. These predators value their own perverted pleasure over a child’s welfare, and in many cases, the child’s very life.  I give an invitation for champions to rise up, to deny self and live as warriors of the forgotten children of sex trafficking and labor slavery. As you read this, countless tears are falling from innocent eyes, hope for freedom is being crushed under a pervert’s control, and children are fading away without anyone ever knowing their names.  Who will save the children?  Will it be you?  Bruce Ladebu Children’s Rescue Initiative

name: Children's Rescue Initiative
content: Irena Sendler and her friends rescued Jewish children out of the ghettos. Irena worked with ten others in an underground network that she established in Poland during World War II. Some of the methods used to smuggle Jewish children included using an ambulance and hiding children under the stretcher, or if quite young, utilizing a trolley to transport children hidden in sacks or suitcases. Irena and her team also used the ghetto’s sewer pipes as an underground passage to the ...outside. Through these methods, Irena and her supporters rescued 2,500 children. We celebrate Irena Sendler this March in honor of Women’s History Month.  Irena Sendler is the perfect inspiration for us today as we face an estimated 40.3 million people in modern slavery. Visit our website to see how you can join us in rescuing children from slavery. #ChildrensRescue #CRI #Antitrafficking #HumanTrafficking #Slavery #LaborSlavery #IrenaSendler #Holocaust #WorldWar2 #Underground #WomensHistoryMonth #WomensHistoryMonth2021 #WomensHistory #Rescue #Freedom #Awareness #Hope #BeTheChange #MakeADifference #BringHope

name: Children's Rescue Initiative
content: Rescued!!!! Early last week, four precious girls were rescued out of the evils of forced labor and sex slavery and brought into a new life of freedom! They were severely malnourished, had been abused daily, and were forced to work long exhausting days in a brick kiln run by brutal slave masters. The parents of the two eldest girls died three years ago. The 7-year-old twins had lost their mother, and their father became mentally unstable. Consequently, these young orphans were... enslaved in hard labor for the rest of their lives to pay off the debts of their parents. Today, however, these precious little girls are now free! They will never again make bricks in the scorching desert heat, endure continuous abuse, or be trapped in the darkness of slavery. Now these young girls live in a very loving home (with other previously rescued girls, some of whom are in the photos) where they receive medical care, nutritious food, new clothing, an education and a lot of nurturing care. They are now on the journey of healing and growth and have hope for a bright future in freedom.

name: Children's Rescue Initiative
content: On International Women's Day we would like to take a moment to celebrate the women who are part of CRI. Not only do we have many women working within our organization but we've had many women join us in our TEAMS and Medical training.  With over 40 million people enslaved in our world we are keenly aware that we cannot fight this battle alone. Rescue missions require many volunteers -- rescue operators who are our boots on the ground, medics, and overseers of aftercare. There... are many working tirelessly "behind the scenes" stateside as well. Many of these volunteers are women. And we thank all of you for your efforts and time. We could not do this without you.  We are specifically looking for women to come join our trainings this year as we believe that women participating in children's rescues is imperative. Check out our website for more info how you can Rescue, Restore, and Raise up! #CRI #ChildrensRescue #Rescue #Antitrafficking #HumanTrafficking #EndTrafficking #SexTrafficking #SlaveLabor #Abolition #Women #InternationalWomensDay #IWD2021 #HumanRights #BringHope #Awareness #Educate #BeTheChange

name: Children's Rescue Initiative
content: March is Women’s History Month, a celebration that’s taken place since the late 90’s to commemorate the vital role women have played in American History. We’d like to observe women from our past and present, from all over the world, who have made a lasting difference in the lives of children. Many Indian girls during the late 1800’s were dedicated to the gods, and were required to live with the temple priests who forced the children into prostitution for profit. When Amy arri...ved in India and heard about these atrocities, she was determined to whatever she could to rescue these children. Amy would dye her skin with coffee and dress in Hindu clothing in order to sneak into the temples and take the children! Amy rescued hundreds of children this way. The first child she took into her home was a seven-year-old girl named Preena. Amy overcame gender prejudice, health limitations, and her own personal fears in order to rescue these children. Her sacrifice and love truly made a difference and earned her the name of “Amma” or “revered mother” by the people of India. #ChildrensRescue #CRI #Antitrafficking #HumanTrafficking #Slavery #LaborSlavery #AmyCarmichael #India #Mother #WomensHistoryMonth #WomensHistoryMonth2021 #WomensHistory #Rescue #Freedom

name: Child Rescue Coalition
content: "I was disturbed to read of an idea to create access to a messaging app for even younger children.  Without rigorous controls to avoid any ability for online predators to contact them, for kids to send pictures and videos, or for potentially distressing texts to be sent -- then I'm very concerned. User-generated content and addressing the risks children take online is already a huge challenge. Adding even younger kids to the mix? Doesn't sound good to me." - Glen Pounder, COO of Child Rescue Coalition and former law enforcement

name: Child Rescue Coalition
content: ⚠️[𝗧𝗥𝗜𝗚𝗚𝗘𝗥 𝗪𝗔𝗥𝗡𝗜𝗡𝗚]⚠️️ 𝗦𝗨𝗥𝗩𝗜𝗩𝗢𝗥 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗥𝗬: 𝗝𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗺𝘆 When Jeremy turned 24, his life began to change. He started having severe bouts of sadness. These episodes started lasting hours, and they came coupled with memories of when he was a young 8-year-old boy and was abused. He had decided to fight the memories, but that wasn't working only making things worse. He knew he needed to do something about it, so he searched for an outlet to express what had happened to him. He started using... open mics as a way of sharing his story to encourage others but the audience there was not right for his platform and he would at times get harassed. He thought he couldn’t take one more night, but knew the best option was to keep going. He started getting creative with how he told his story and it was catching people’s attention. And with this, he knew he was on to something. Jeremy has now been speaking out in public for two years. He, like us, believes that we must bring more attention to this subject, which is essential if we stand any chance of breaking the stigma and the silence.  Let's encourage others to #jointhefight and speak out because that's the first step into making a change.

name: Child Rescue Coalition
content: Thanks to our CRC Technology, the civil police in Brazil have charged a suspect with offenses relating to horrific child sexual abuse material following an investigation.  Officers found that this activity had been ongoing for at least 8 months and will now carry out further inquiries to assess which other offenses he may also have committed against children. We are proud to contribute to putting a stop to these perpetrators and will continue our mission to keep kids safe. Read the full story here: https://childrescuecoalition.org/suspect-charged-in-brazil…/

name: Child Rescue Coalition
content: 🚨 BREAKING NEWS 🚨  Instagram is rolling out new safety features aimed at protecting users under the age of 18 from adults they don't know. Main points: 📝  - If the minor does not follow the adult, it will prevent adults from messaging them. - If an adult a minor is already connected to "has been exhibiting suspicious behavior", minors will also receive prompts urging caution in their messages. - It will make it harder for adults to discover younger users and diminish their ability to follow them. Our thoughts? 💭  Anything the big tech companies do to proactively protect children using their platforms is welcome. While more could be done, here’s just one example of their ability to take action from an online grooming perspective.

name: Child Rescue Coalition
content: This information from Bark - Parental Controls is critical for every parent to know.

name: Child Rescue Coalition
content: “There’s an app for that.” Technology has become an integral part of our day-to-day life.  But did you know apps can be harming your kids in ways you didn't even know? Apps may make our lives easier, but there's also a downside.  The apps that seem convenient for you might also be a convenient entry point for a child predator into your home and your child’s life.  Discussing with your family about which apps they’re using and what features they have will help you carry out a “health check” to the security of your home.  Learn more about the 8 things risky apps have in common that make them prime vehicles for predators to access your child: https://childrescuecoalition.org/…/mobile-magic-or-download…...

name: Child Rescue Coalition
content: CRC Technology is often just the starting point for investigators using proactive strategies to identify those with a dangerous and highly illegal sexual interest in children. Law enforcement and prosecutors must then begin the long and challenging job of bringing the suspect to justice. In this case the perpetrator, Michael Lawrence Feith, has just been sentenced to seven years in prison, which will be followed by a lifetime of supervised release and his addition to the sex offenders registry. Thankfully he should never be able to gain unsupervised access to children or work in a position of trust. Excellent work by all concerned. https://childrescuecoalition.org/seven-year-sentence-for-n…/

name: Child Rescue Coalition
content: It's #WomensHistoryMonth and in honor of this we want to highlight women who are working to fight childhood sexual abuse.  One of our long-time partners we'd like to spotlight is Moe McClanahan. Moe McClanahan is the Director of Training and Education with the Safe Surfin’ Foundation, which is a non-profit organization with the mission of educating and equipping both parents and kids on being safe online. She also serves as a High-Tech Crime Specialist with the National White... Collar Crime Center (NW3C). Recently retired after 20 yrs of service from the Christiansburg Police Department (CPD) in Virginia. Moe served her last 8.5 years at CPD as the Internet Crimes Against Children (ICAC) Investigator. During her time as an ICAC Investigator, she trained and educated over 10,000 children, parents, and police officers in Internet safety. "I believe that every child deserves to grow up happy and healthy! Educating and empowering both parents and kids to be safe online and protect them from the predators I know that are out there is the BEST way I can help protect that happiness. So many parents are unaware of the dangers online and through virtual events and our Live For Tuesday show on Instagram, I can at least create awareness and help get the conversations started in the home" says, Moe. Thank you Moe for being a supporter and for helping to further protect children!

name: Covenant Rescue Group
content: Human trafficking doesn’t care about politics. It’s not a right wing conservative or a left wing liberal issue. It doesn’t care which administration sits in the White House. Human trafficking is the devaluing of a human life that was created in the image of God. It’s evil. And it has to be stopped. Covenant Rescue Group is going to continue business as usual despite what is going on within our country. Because as long as there are captives, we will fight for them. #endtrafficking #crg #crushevil

name: DeliverFund
content: The fight against human trafficking involves seeing the worst of humanity. It's a cause that many people feel strongly about, particularly when it involves children.  But taking matters into your own hands as a civilian is not the answer.  Law enforcement are the only entity who can legally hold human traffickers accountable, and DeliverFund works within legal parameters and directly with our law enforcement partners.  Vigilantism is often dangerous and illegal, and more importantly, it can make problems worse for victims. Please bear in mind that searching out and sharing child sexual abuse material, no matter your intentions, is illegal and makes you complicit in the continued exploitation of victims. It also boosts the platform's algorithms, which assists the predators in finding like-minded people to trade images.  For more resources on how you can safely get involved in counter human trafficking, please see our previous post on what civilians can do: https://www.facebook.com/DeliverFund/posts/2764408333883020

name: DeliverFund
content: How does DeliverFund's Senior Targeting Analyst Kara Smith deal with seeing the worst of humanity while at work? What are the best careers to get into the fight against #HumanTrafficking? ⁠ ⁠ A special Q&A edition of Hunting with the Huntress is on our YouTube channel today--click the link below to watch! ⁠ https://youtu.be/_wnoRNKn_PQ

name: DeliverFund
content: Today is a special day--it's the 17th anniversary of our Director of Strategic Impact Author Sandy Storm's Day of Freedom! We'd like to invite you to join the fight against #HumanTrafficking with us to celebrate.  Click the link below to #DeliverHope!... https://bit.ly/3r0hxZs

name: DeliverFund
content: "Now I have so much hope for others who are trapped in that world, because I got out and I know they can too!⁠ ⁠ I believe if DeliverFund had existed when I was being trafficked, I could have gotten free sooner. ⁠ ⁠ And because DeliverFund is working with law enforcement agencies across the nation, there are many others like me who will have a chance at freedom today.⁠... ⁠ In honor of my 17 years of freedom, and as a way of celebrating HOPE that others can find freedom as well, we would like to challenge you to join the fight and partner with us for just $17/month over the next 17 months. ⁠ ⁠ Every time you see the auto-draft on your bank account or see the transaction on your credit card statement, remember there are so many others like me, trapped in the life of sexual slavery, crying out for freedom from the bondage they are caught in each day. ⁠ ⁠ By partnering with DeliverFund you are extending a lifeline to those victims, and making a way for them to go from being survivors to becoming THRIVERS"⁠ 3/3 ⁠ ⁠ Click to join the fight today! ⁠https://deliverfund.networkforgood.com/…/66434-deliverfund-…

name: DeliverFund
content: "On March 18, 2004 I found the end of my rope. ⁠ ⁠ I finally gave up, gave in, and I got out. ⁠ ⁠ After years of constant abuse and instability, after two decades of trauma and torment, I finally found the strength to break free once and for all.⁠... ⁠ That day, everything changed. ⁠ ⁠ No longer was I a sex slave, being driven from brothel to brothel by an enterprising trafficker, but I was now a free woman, and I had another chance at living a free life!⁠ ⁠ I found HOPE that day.⁠ ⁠ I found FREEDOM that day.⁠ ⁠ I found out that I have a choice that day, and I chose LIFE!"⁠ 2/3⁠ #HumanTrafficking

name: DeliverFund
content: From our Director of Strategic Impact, Author Sandy Storm:  March 18, 2004 is a special day for me, because that is the day I broke free from a life in the industry of commercial sexual exploitation. I was a victim of human trafficking for 20 years, starting at the age of 6 years old, continuing into my mid-twenties. I was addicted to drugs and most of my life had been spent under the control of traffickers who would put me out in the marketplace like a product.  I was in constant bondage to the lifestyle itself and could never picture myself as anything else than the labels the world had placed on me. I was helpless and hopeless and had burned every bridge and bitten every hand that had attempted to help me. I was spiraling on a destructive course through life and the only destination I was on target for was an early grave. BUT THAT IS NOT THE END OF MY STORY. 1/3 #HumanTrafficking

Not all of us are in a position to intervene, and, as Senior Targeting Analyst Kara Smith states on the Coach Mo Podcast, there are several reasons why the majority of civilians shouldn’t directly intervene in a #HumanTrafficking situation.

name: DeliverFund
content: Our deadline is approaching for the next Counter Human Trafficking Intelligence Operators Course (CHTIOC). ⁠ ⁠ If you are law enforcement and would like to take a class that teaches and enhances the skills needed to successfully identify human traffickers, their victims and networks, please register via LETraining@deliverfund.org.

name: DeliverFund
content: Human trafficking--this includes sex trafficking and labor trafficking--is happening right in our backyards. Illicit businesses mask as legitimate ones while selling victims' bodies and pocketing the revenue.  But if you cut off the head of the snake, you can disrupt the cycle of exploitation. This is why DeliverFund's focus, and our support to law enforcement, is about taking out the human traffickers themselves.   This is outstanding work from our partners at the Ventura Co...unty Human Trafficking Task Force! It's always an honor to be #CrushingEvil with you! 👊👊👊 https://www.vcstar.com/…/sheriffs-detectives-bu…/4598228001/

name: DeliverFund
content: Human traffickers aren't born knowing how to exploit victims. So where do they get their "education"? And who is Iceberg Slim?  DeliverFund's Senior Targeting Analyst Kara Smith hunts human traffickers on the internet. Our YouTube series follows her work as she shows us how traffickers operate, what signs to look for, and what DeliverFund is doing to end human trafficking in America.  Click the link below to watch the latest episode, and make sure you Like and Subscribe to ou...r YouTube channel so more people can see our videos!  https://youtu.be/Dj1QQcG3L-Y

name: DeliverFund
content: “The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.” - Edmund Burke When you know the extent of #HumanTrafficking that is happening by Americans to Americans, staying neutral is not an option.  Shop DeliverFund's online store and join the fight to end human trafficking by giving our analysts and law enforcement partners across the country the resources they need to make sure traffickers stay behind bars.  shop.deliverfund.org

name: DeliverFund
content: #Repost @andystumpf212 "Episode 171 is up with Nic McKinley. Be warned, this subject matter is not for the faint of heart, and this one should not be played around kids. As an Operative who served as a Country Chief for a Special Unit within the CIA, Nic witnessed not only the epidemic of child trafficking within illicit markets but also the unrealized opportunity to apply his understanding and training to influence this global crisis. When Nic began to work with experts to b...etter understand the problem in the United States he found it impossible to turn a blind eye. As a result, DeliverFund was officially established as a 501c3 in October 2014 as a counter-human trafficking organization, focused on ending sex slavery in the United States. Nic spent 11 years in US Special Operations as an Air Force Pararescueman prior to being recruited to the Central Intelligence Agency. Due to his highly specialized training and experience in both special and intelligence operations, Nic has a firm understanding of these illicit, illegal markets and has the highest levels of training to effectively combat them." Click to listen: https://youtu.be/NCqIFu--gf4

name: Destiny Rescue
content: The health needs of beneficiaries rescued by Destiny Rescue are numerous. These issues can relate directly to the nature of their role within the sex industry, or arise from a life of poverty and limited access to health care services. We seek to meet both the physical and emotional health care needs of girls under our care. When girls come through our programs, we identify areas of need,... evaluate, facilitate, and implement solutions to safeguard their health and improve their quality of life and wellbeing. This can include education courses on sexual health, relationships and nutrition, as well as trauma recovery. Watch this candid and inspiring documentary, on the challenges our rescued face, and how our Destiny Rescue teams support them. Due to the mature subject matter, this film may not be suitable for children under 16 Watch the full Documentary here: https://www.destinyrescue.org.au/summer-rescue-reels-healt…/ #irescue #childtrafficking #onechildistoomany

name: Destiny Rescue
content: RESCUE UPDATE: Nine girls, ages 15-23 thought their traffickers were bringing them to a hotel for another night of being sold and abused. Instead, they were rescued by our team of agents in partnership with law enforcement and their two traffickers were arrested. #humantrafficking #destinyrescue

name: Destiny Rescue
content: Children should be used for sex profiteering. Yes? No? If you are adamant that children should NOT be sold for sex, then we invite you to share your comments below.  Did you know… according to UNICEF, more than 2 million children are subjected to forced prostitution in the global commercial sex trade. These victims are usually deceived or coerced with the offer of employment, or “a better life,” and extorted under some of the most inhumane conditions imaginable. Tell us your thoughts and concerns in the comment section below. We would also like to know, what is YOUR HOPE for a future without slavery? If you have not heard of us before, we are Destiny Rescue — an international organization determined to end the trafficking and sexual exploitation of children. Destiny Rescue's highly-trained agents go undercover into some of the darkest places on the planet — searching for children trapped in harmful situations. Once identified, our rescue teams work relentlessly to bring them to freedom. "We exist because we believe no child should be forced to have sex with adults - EVER!” — Tony Kirwan, Founder & President of Destiny Rescue The problem might seem overwhelming, but the good news is we CAN do something about it! Would you like to learn more?  FOLLOW our Facebook Page  Until all are free! #childtrafficking #destinyrescue #onechildistoomany

name: Destiny Rescue
content: While many participated in the excitement of Cyber Monday with Christmas shopping in full swing, we're reflecting on our first cyber rescue case involving a 2-and-a-half-year-old. In February, our teams, in coordination with multiple law-enforcement agencies, executed an operation that rescued a young boy from a life of continued sexual exploitation. Watch the rescue operation unfold and hear from Destiny Rescue's Rescue Manager in the Philippines.

name: Destiny Rescue
content: Today is International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women.  This is a global observance day to combat and raise awareness of gender-based violence against women across the world. Simply because they are female, these people endure violence and aggression such as punching, rape and intimidation among a long list of others.   According to a report in 2015 by the United Nations, one in three women and girls worldwide have experienced physical or sexual violence at... some point in their life. Most of the time, it is by an “intimate partner,” which is either a current or former partner or spouse.  Continue reading: https://2dr.li/5Bio

name: Destiny Rescue
content: Whether it is spoken about in newspapers, social media or even cafes, child sex trafficking is becoming an increasingly hot topic across the world.  But in the age of the internet – where people are constantly neck deep in information – the line between truth and fiction about issues can blur. For child sex trafficking, it is important to know the truth to correctly protect and educate others and - ultimately - end the trade.  To help set the record straight, Destiny Rescue h...as drawn on its nearly 20 years of experience to explain the basic reality of child sex trafficking in Southeast Asia. Keep reading: https://2dr.li/5Bi0 #childsextrafficking #destinyrescue #onechildistoomany

content: Girls in our Community Reintegration Program in Thailand shared with Miw, Reintegration Manager, the blessings in their lives. This was one of them. Help more individuals know freedom and hope: https://2dr.li/5BhU #humantraffickingawareness #destinyrescue #onechildistoomany

name: ECPAT International
content: A man who ran a child-modelling agency in Thailand was arrested for child sexual exploitation last week. Police uncovered over 500,000 sexual abuse images with children aged 6 to 15. So far, over 40 Thai children were identified. Thousands more are yet to be identified around the world. Cases like this are stark reminders of three important facts ECPAT has been advocating for. Read more👇

name: ECPAT International
content: ⚠️️Children in the EU are still in danger online⚠️ It's been 6 weeks since a new EU e-privacy law has put child safety at risk. 6 weeks later, 51% less reports are being made to the hotline National Center for Missing & Exploited Children - that means 51% less alerts that could help: ◾️ identify a child and remove them from a situation of abuse ◾️ find offenders who are sexually exploiting children online, and bring them to justice   ◾️ remove sexual pictures of a child that ...are being circulated online - thus protecting the child's privacy and safety The drop in reports is getting bigger, and with every % it means less chance of justice for children who are being sexually exploited. This can't go on. The EU must protect children NOW.  Learn more ➡️https://www.change.org/p/council-of-the-european-union-we-are-in-danger-of-losing-the-global-battle-for-child-safety

name: ECPAT International
content: In 2015-2016, nearly half (647) of registered child victims of trafficking in the EU were Hungarian. 86% of them were girls. So what’s behind these figures and why are children in Hungary at high risk of trafficking and sexual exploitation? Today we launch the #Hungary country overview with our member Hintalovon Gyermekjogi Alapítvány, and share what we know.

name: ECPAT International
content: This #ValentinesDay, as most places continue to be in lockdown, it may not only be flowers and chocolates that are being sent. There is also a chance that children and young people will be taking and sending nude photos and videos to people they think they can trust. And this also means children and young people are at risk of being blackmailed. Here's what you need to know👇

name: ECPAT International
content: On 21 December 2020, a new law came into force in the EU. It was meant to advance ePrivacy, but did not factor in the potential risk to children. Today on #SaferInternetDay2021, join us in asking the EU to do better at protecting it's children online. Here's what you need to know👇 https://ecpat.exposure.co/safer-internet

name: ECPAT International
content: 📢Our latest newsletter is out! Find a preview of our work for 2021,  and some practical advice for parents and adults on how you can help keep children safe online as lockdowns carry on and offenders continue to take advantage of the situation.⁠ #Subscribe for monthly updates! Read it here 👉https://bit.ly/3pPflnJ

name: ECPAT International
content: In the three weeks after a new EU law caused some companies, including Facebook, to stop scanning their platforms for child sexual abuse material, there was a 46% drop in reports from the EU Member States. This is devastating.⁠💔 ⁠ A proposal is currently on the table that would maintain the status quo so that tech companies can continue to detect, remove and report child sexual abuse material is currently on the table. The European Commission, Council of the European Union, a...nd the European Parliament need to meet and agree on a temporary suspension of the part of the law that prohibits scanning. ⁠ ⁠ Unbelievably, this is being opposed by Birgit Sippel, who's representing the Parliament in the discussions. She's insisting on changes which cannot be met within any reasonable timeframe, arguing the scanning tools are a threat to privacy.⁠ ⁠ ‼️But let's set things straight.‼️ Privacy laws were never meant to make it difficult to locate and delete pictures of a child being sexually abused. They were not meant to make it easier for an offender grooming a child for sexual purposes. And the tools that are being used pose NO threat at all to anybody’s privacy.⁠ ⁠ So please, Birgit Sippel! You can change this, and that's why we're asking you to agree to the temporary suspension. To anyone reading this: join us and ECPAT Sverige, ECPAT Österreich, ECPAT Deutschland, Fundacja Dajemy Dzieciom Siłę, Defence for Children, and Pelastakaa Lapset in asking her to reconsider. Now!

name: ECPAT International
content: In the three weeks following 20th December 2020, there was a 46% drop in reports of online child sex abuse from EU Member States. Because companies have stopped scanning for it. Because a new e-Privacy law requires them to, and the EU's political Trilogue has failed to reach a temporary solution. Every day this continues, more children are put at risk.⚠️

name: ECPAT International
content: Here's what you as an adult can do to help children be safe online!!✊ Follow us on instagram.com/ecpat for more.

name: ECPAT International
content: From instagram.com/ecpat: The stories of how our members Maiti Nepal and Sanlaap India are helping survivors of child trafficking earn law degrees and become their own advocates to bring perpetrators of sexual crimes against children to justice, is featured in Al Jazeera English!!⁠ School for Justice is for survivors of sexual exploitation and their daughters in Kolkata, Mumbai and Kathmandu. ⁠“I am so much wiser now. I know my rights, how child trafficking operates, the sign...s young girls should watch out for,” says one student. “I want to bring girls who have been exploited out of the darkness and make them aware of the legal options available to them.”⁠ ⁠ Sherpa was raped by a neighbour at 11 years old. At the age of 15-17, she was sexually exploited at the dance bar she worked for to pay for her mother’s medical treatment. Last summer, at the age of 20, she joined the School for Justice in Kathmandu.⁠ “Since I have enrolled in the law course I don’t feel like the same person anymore — from being a poor student in school to being diagnosed with depression, I have finally learned to focus, to have a goal. I can speak confidently in front of people,” she says.⁠ Another student, Khatun, was trafficked by a man she met in college, who sexually exploited her at a brothel for two months. When she managed to get away to meet her family, she also reported the crime. No one was arrested and she didn’t get the justice she was looking for.⁠ “It took me years to get my life together. But the man who raped me roams free. Back then, I did not know how to protect myself and what my rights were after being raped. Now I want to make sure it doesn’t happen to other girls.” ⁠✊⁠ Children and survivors are at the centre of the ECPAT member's work. We’re proud to see the results of their important work — how it empowers survivors of sexual exploitation them in a way that brings their lived experience at the centre of driving change.⁠ ⁠ Read full article: https://www.aljazeera.com/…/the-child-trafficking-survivors… 📷 Free a Girl through Al Jazeera English

name: ECPAT International
content: The true essence of ECPAT is its network and the many remarkable and committed individuals representing them.✊ It is through the inspiration of all of our members that we are hopeful that in the future, a world free from child sexual exploitation can become a reality. Here's what we've achieved in 30 years, and what we hope to do in the next 30.

name: ECPAT International
content: Everyone has the right to privacy, absolutely. But children also have the right to protection from sexual exploitation and violence. We can’t polarise the e-Privacy debate by saying it has to be one or the other, we have to look for solutions that allow for both. The EU can and should be leading the way on this. We won't accept anything else.

name: ECPAT International
content: As COVID-19 continues to spread, many children across the globe are at increased risk of sexual exploitation; in the Middle East and North Africa, harmful gender norms and armed conflict are threatening children’s safety; and Thailand is not only turquoise water and friendly smiles.
