name: Love Justice International
content: Next up in our recipe roundup from our global cookbook is from LJI Uganda! Muchomo refers to a popular Ugandan street food consisting of different types of roasted meat like beef, pork, goat, or chicken. The meat is marinated in a sauce and then grilled on skewers until it is crispy on the outside and tender and juicy on the inside. In Uganda, the most popular choices are goat and pork. ⁠ ⁠ Save this post so you can grab your ingredients, cook it up, and let us know what you ...think! Link in our bio for more information on LJI Uganda. ⁠ ⁠ Ingredients:⁠ 2 ¼ pounds of either goat, pork, beef, or chicken⁠ Juice of 1 lemon or approximately⁠ 2 tablespoons of lemon juice⁠ 1 grated onion (optional)⁠ 1–2 tablespoons vegetable or olive oil (used to prevent sticking, or you can apply it to the grill)⁠ ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)⁠ ½ teaspoon coriander powder⁠ ½ teaspoon onion powder⁠ ¼ teaspoon black pepper⁠ 1 tablespoon salt (to taste)⁠ ⁠ Directions:⁠ Put the meat in a Ziploc bag.⁠ Combine and stir the marinade ingredients and then pour it over the meat in the Ziploc bag.⁠ Marinate in the refrigerator overnight or for at least 1 hour.⁠ Roast the meat on skewers over a low flame for as long as possible without overcooking.⁠ Grill it on low heat very slowly so that the meat has an outside crunch with a tender, juicy center.⁠ Serve with salt and a side of hot peppers, avocados, and tomatoes.⁠ ⁠

name: Love Justice International
content: Malawi is a source country for trafficking, a transit country for individuals trafficked to South Africa, and, to a lesser extent, a destination country for people from neighboring countries.  Since its inception in 2018, LJI Malawi has intercepted more than 1,300 individuals to prevent them from being trafficked. Learn more:

name: Love Justice International
content: “God gave me this opportunity. He gave me such a wonderful family where I receive lots of love, care, and support. Yes, it’s true; I am so happy because God chose me among so many other street children who haven’t had this opportunity. I am just really thankful toward God.”—Devaja, LJI Family Homes graduate Read her story: https://lvjus.tc/3eFj98z

name: Love Justice International
content: #BREAKING LJI Rwanda monitor intercepts two minor girls at bus station and helps arrest two suspects! Two girls, Kito* (12) and Joyeuse* (3), were trafficked by Gerald* and Claudine*. They were abducted from their homes without their parents noticing. One of our female monitors first spotted the young children at a busy bus station, crying and alone. The monitor started asking them questions, and they told her that some people had taken them from their homes, dropping them of...f at the bus station and promising to return soon. After hearing Kito and Joyeuse’s story, our monitor hid off to the side to see if the traffickers might return. Later, the two suspects returned, and our monitor requested assistance from a nearby security officer. During questioning, the two suspects provided contradictory information. Based on this red flag, our monitor reported the case to the police, and Gerald and Claudine were arrested, pending further investigation. The monitor then contacted the parents of the children and informed them of the situation. Later that day, Kito and Joyeuse were officially handed back into the care of their parents, who were thankful for our staff’s assistance. Learn more about how our monitors work to stop traffickers in their tracks: https://lvjus.tc/3ciA5Pb *Pseudonyms

name: Love Justice International
content: Since its inception in 2018, LJI Uganda has intercepted more than 400 individuals to prevent them from being trafficked.

name: Love Justice International
content: Most people don’t know this, but Love Justice began as a ministry to children who were orphaned, abandoned, or abused and had no place to go but the streets..There were hundreds—if not thousands—of children roaming the streets of Thamel, an area in the middle of Kathmandu’s tourist district, begging or stealing whatever they could in order to stay alive. This is where our team met Devaja. Read her story: https://lvjus.tc/3cn6jsK

name: Love Justice International
content: #BREAKING LJI Nepal monitors intercepted two minor females in June of 2018. Their suspects were arrested and today, the first suspect has been convicted!  A human trafficking and rape case was filed in 2018. The victims involved in this case, two females Nigam* (17)  and Shila* (15), were intercepted by our staff at Kakarvitta station, as they were crossing the border with two male suspects: Pramod* and Harka*.  During questioning, our team discovered the minor girls had been... raped multiple times by the two suspects. Pramod and Harka had been close friends since childhood. Nigam shared that she had been in a relationship with Pramod for several months. Meanwhile, Shila said that she and Harka were also in a relationship, and she told our team that he had asked her to marry him, even though she was underage and only 15 years old.  One day, Harka asked Shila to travel with him to Kathmandu for a job, and he suggested that she would be able to earn a lucrative salary there. Shila agreed and traveled with him to Kathmandu. Shortly after they arrived, Harka took Shila to a hotel, where he abused her before they eventually met up with Nigam and Pramod. The men convinced the two females to travel to Dharan with them in search of work. When they arrived in Dharan, Harka and Pramod took the two girls to an unidentified hotel room and abused them again. After that, they took them to the Kakarvitta border and prepared to cross over to India where they planned to stay in Pramod’s home. Our team helped the two females file cases against their suspects. Nigam’s case against Pramod is ongoing. However, in Shila’s case, the court has taken action against Harka, sentencing him to seven years in jail for rape and eight years for human trafficking. In total, Harka was sentenced to 15 years in jail and issued a hefty fine for his crimes.  If you want to find out what you can do to intervene in these stories, learn more about Project Beautiful: our community of justice fighters who give monthly to protect individuals, like Nigam and Shila, and to stop human traffickers BEFORE exploitation and abuse can occur. Project Beautiful members are also critical for funding our investigation efforts to use data to track down suspects and larger networks at play and to help victims file cases against their suspected traffickers. Learn more: https://lvjus.tc/3t0eBxf *Pseudonyms

name: Love Justice International
content: On International Women's Day, (and every day), we celebrate our local female leaders around the world who put their lives on the line to protect other women from being trafficked into slavery, who #ChooseToChallenge the injustice of human trafficking and fight for the value of every one life. https://lvjus.tc/30oIWJS #iwd2021

name: Love Justice International
content: “You may choose to look the other way but you can never say again that you did not know.” ― William Wilberforce

name: Love Justice International
content: #BREAKING LJI Kenya monitors intercept young female being lured to Saudi Arabia with suspicious job offer! Recently, our staff was monitoring at a busy bus station when they noticed a young female clutching a small bag who seemed disoriented and upset. They moved closer to her and noticed she was talking to someone on her phone, giving them directions to her location. Concerned for her safety, our monitors approached her for questioning. During the interview, she said that he...r name was Gladys* and she was 22 years old. She shared that the poverty levels at her home had pushed her to search for work anywhere. She explained how an agent had organized a job for her where she would be working in Saudi Arabia. This particular agent organized the job through another agent in Nairobi. Gladys stated that this agent was on his way to pick her up at the station and take her to a hostel where she would be staying until she could be transported to Saudi Arabia for her new job. As Gladys was sharing the details of her future employment, our staff recognized multiple red flags and immediately intercepted her to keep her safe. They forwarded all the information she had shared with them to officials for further investigation, and they plan to follow up on this case as it proceeds. https://lvjus.tc/38e3yZu *Pseudonym

name: Love Justice International
content: When you think of anti-trafficking work, data is probably not the first thing that comes to mind. But in our fight against human trafficking, data coupled with innovative technology has proved to be a formidable weapon.

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: It can be daunting for survivors to enter a new aftercare home especially when they aren’t yet familiar with who will be caring for them. Having a therapy dog present can help survivors feel safe and comforted, especially during their first few nights in the aftercare home! ⁠ ⁠ We are excited to announce our partnership with Green Valley Australian Shepherds. We are starting a new dog therapy program to provide dogs for some of the aftercare homes we partner with in the United States.

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: “The Boy in the Green Shirt” investigation didn’t end with the arrest of Simon’s offender at that Burger King.

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: ❌ In a recent NCMEC analysis of CyberTipline reports of online enticement, it was found that nearly all the children did not know the person they were communicating with online. (NCMEC) ❌ As defined by the FBI, sextortion is a crime that happens online when an adult convinces a person that is younger than 18 to share sexual pictures or perform sexual acts on a webcam. ❌ In sextortion cases, first contact is typically by phone via a social media friend request. Victims are tar...geted on platforms they frequent. (Thorn)  Because children and teens have increased access to the internet, it is important to help them understand safe practices. See our blog for 5 essential resources to help you navigate these conversations. https://ourrescue.org/…/5-essential-online-safety-resources/

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: Have you read “The Boy in the Green Shirt”? This story, written by an O.U.R. Operator, is about an investigation that started in Southeast Asia after police found photos of an unidentified young boy in a green shirt being sexually assaulted. The offender had unique, identifiable physical traits, so law enforcement was able to quickly identify a citizen with matching traits to this alleged offender. They requested the support of the O.U.R. Ops Team to gather additional intelligence which may help find the young boy in the green shirt.  ⁠ ⁠ “The Boy in the Green Shirt” case has since led to the identification of more survivors. We are excited to share more with you soon.

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: “Clara” is a survivor from South America who was exploited on Pornhub. In recent conversations with the O.U.R. Aftercare Team, she said, “Thank you for everything. I never thought I would meet someone who would help me so much.” The O.U.R. Aftercare Team has been supporting through her journey of healing. We are inspired by her strength to overcome the difficult things she has faced.  Traffickinghub is helping empower survivors of sex trafficking to access therapy and justice after being exploited on Pornhub and other big porn sites.  To that end, our aftercare specialists have connected with and endorsed the #Traffickinghub campaign, founded by Laila Mickelwait and powered by Exodus Cry.

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: K9 Spike is an O.U.R.-sponsored electronic storage device (ESD) detection K9 in Pennsylvania, USA. From August to December 2020, Spike assisted on 17 search warrants, which led to the arrest of 18 child predators and the identification of 7 child survivors. One arrest (1st picture) came after the discovery of videos of the 26-year-old suspect sexually abusing a young girl. A woman found the videos on the man's laptop and alerted authorities. A 39-year-old man (2nd picture) wa...s arrested on 40 counts of possessing child sexual abuse material and 1 count of disseminating it. The material was found on his cell phone after local law enforcement receiving a tip that he had uploaded a video of child sexual abuse to Facebook.  Brendan Carter, a 30-year-old former band director in Pennsylvania (3rd picture), was recently found guilty of all 22 counts brought against him, including indecent assault, corruption of minors, and possession and solicitation of child sexual abuse material.  The additional images are of other alleged child predators. O.U.R.-sponsored K9 Spike assisted local law enforcement in executing search warrants in these investigations. Your continued support will enable us to expand our K9 program and further identify child predators and rescue young survivors. We are grateful for K9 Spike and local law enforcement who work diligently to keep our children safe.

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: We know it’s going to take everyone to end modern-day slavery. That’s why we have created a program especially for students who want to make a difference. Our Students Against Trafficking initiative supports students of any grade to spread awareness and support the cause! We offer different ways to get involved and want to help you every step of the way. Here is the site to get started: https://ourrescue.org/…/we-need-students-against-trafficki…/

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: O.U.R. Aftercare Director Jessica Mass was not expecting anything unusual to happen on her taxi ride to an aftercare home in South America. The taxi pulled up to the aftercare home, which was built to be very discreet. Right as Jessica pulled the door handle to exit, the taxi driver turned around and looked at her with tears in his eyes. “I grew up here,” he said. He began explaining his story. He was abandoned as a child and left to live on the streets. He was forced to take... drugs, which led to a cycle of addiction and theft at a very young age. When he was seven years old, Child Protective Services found him and took him to the aftercare home that Jessica was heading to. “If it wasn’t for this aftercare home, I would have stayed homeless, at high risk to being sexually exploited and addicted to drugs,” he said. “Instead, I am able to have a healthy, stable family.” Because of this very aftercare home, his life was changed forever. After he graduated from the aftercare home, he was able to attend a university for some time. This experience helped him learn how to run his own business as a taxi driver. Now over 40 years old, he has a family of his own with a wife and three beautiful children. “Not only did this home change my life, but it taught me how to be a good father, a good man, and how to protect women and children.” At the end of sharing his story, he had tears of gratitude streaming down his face. There is always hope, and this man is living proof of the positive difference that aftercare can make. O.U.R. was not around yet when this man was rescued off the streets, but this wonderful aftercare home was. Our Aftercare Team is invested in finding these quality homes and building relationships with them so that more survivors have access to quality care. After this tender moment, the taxi driver watched with tears in his eyes as Jessica and her team walked into this aftercare home with high spirits and encouraged hearts.

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: We want to highlight the prevention efforts of one of our partners in South Asia to support and educate girls and women in the workplace. With the support of O.U.R., our partner’s resource center has teamed up with a beauty parlor to offer free services to women and girls. Individuals who come into the center will receive information on human trafficking, child sexual exploitation and other issues. We had 88 women and girls participate in the free beauty services from Novembe...r 2020 to January 2021. The resource center also started hosting bimonthly meetings to further educate women and girls the exploitation they may face in the workplace. These meetings aim to provide a safe space for women and girls to receive help from our partners and local law enforcement, if needed. We were thrilled to see 22 women and girls attend the first meeting and look forward to seeing the turnout at the next one.

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: Since last August, O.U.R.-sponsored K9 Chewie in California has assisted in the cases and arrests of 19 child predators. These cases led to the identification of 8 survivors under the age of 18, including an infant. ⁠ ⁠ One of the arrests (2nd picture) in November resulted in the discovery of over 600 images and videos depicting child exploitation, all connected to one suspect. The man was arrested by local law enforcement. ⁠ ⁠ Another arrest (1st picture) happened after a su...spect, 31 years old, tried to meet a 12-year-old girl with the intention of committing sex crimes. He also was found to possess child exploitation material. ⁠ ⁠ The dedication of all the law enforcement teams involved in these cases is incredible. They are on the front lines of fighting child exploitation, and we are grateful for the work they are doing to protect children. We look forward to sharing more of K9 Chewie's successes in the future! ⁠ ⁠ (Photos courtesy of Riverside County District Attorney's Office)

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: UPDATE! This puppy, “Joy”, recently passed her Assessment Tests and will be trained to be a therapy dog for survivors in one of our partnering aftercare homes. We are starting a new therapy dog program for some of the aftercare homes that we partner with in the United States, and “Joy” is the first puppy to be trained! Wish her luck in her training, and watch our new video to learn more about our new partnership with Green Valley Australian Shepherds! https://youtu.be/RbAoP9dXvn8

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: O.U.R. Aftercare recently held a community engagement opportunity in southern Utah for a survivor, "Angela", who has been taking equine therapy thanks to our partnership with Metropolitan Equestrian Team. Director of MET, Jane DaCosta (second photo), and O.U.R. Aftercare Team Members believe in providing memorable and enjoyable experiences.   We are privileged to work with an incredible and inspiring teenage girl who is a fighter. Angela has fought for her freedom and joy. Sh...e is brave in so many ways! She loves horses and we loved seeing her confidence increase while riding. She also talked about some of her interests she’d like to do after graduating high school, which O.U.R. and @metropolitanequestrianteam will be supporting along the way. Today on #InternationalWomensDay, we’d like to thank Jane DaCosta and the many other women we are privileged to work with who dedicate their lives to anti-trafficking work and the empowering of women and children of all ages. We also honor the women and girls who are survivors and stand as such examples of strength and perseverance to us!

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: It can be daunting for survivors to enter a new aftercare home especially when they aren’t yet familiar with who will be caring for them. Having a therapy dog present can help survivors feel safe and comforted, especially during their first few nights in the aftercare home!  We are excited to announce our partnership with Green Valley Aussies. We are starting a new dog therapy program to provide dogs for some of the aftercare homes we partner with in the United States. Watch the full YouTube video about our partnership with Green Valley Aussies: https://youtu.be/RbAoP9dXvn8

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: 1. Child sex trafficking ❌ Child sex trafficking has been reported in all 50 U.S. States. (NCMEC) ❌ The extent of family involvement in the trafficking of children is up to four times higher than in cases of adult trafficking (CTDC)  ❌ Child sex trafficking refers to the recruitment, harboring, transportation, provision, obtaining, patronizing, or soliciting of a minor for the purpose of a commercial sex act. (justice.gov)⁠ 2. Online exploitation (online enticement) ❌ In a recent NCMEC analysis of CyberTipline reports of online enticement, it was found that nearly all the children did not know the person they were communicating with online. 3. Online exploitation (child sexual abuse material)  ❌ In 2004, NCMEC reviewed 450,000 child sexual abuse files. In 2019, NCMEC reviewed 70 million child sexual abuse files. (NCMEC, found on thorn.org) ❌ Prepubescent children are at the greatest risk to be depicted in child sexual abuse material. (NCMEC)  4. Forced marriage ❌ At any given time in 2016, an estimated 15.4 million people were in forced marriage. (ILO) 5. Forced labor       ❌ At any given time in 2016, an estimated 24.9 million people were in forced labour. (ILO) ❌ Children who are victims of labour exploitation are most commonly forced to beg, undertake domestic work or work in the hospitality sector. (CTDC) 6. Adult sex trafficking  ❌ An estimated 4.8 million people are trapped in forced sexual exploitation globally. (ILO) �Although we have 6 forms of human trafficking and exploitation outlined here, no survivor’s story is the same, and the healing journey looks different for every individual. Read stories about how O.U.R. has supported survivors of each of these crimes on our blog: https://ourrescue.org/…/6-forms-of-human-trafficking-explo…/

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: “Madeline”, who lives in South America, was exploited by an American man who often traveled down to her country to exploit minors. After being identified by law enforcement as someone who was exploited by this man, she was rescued from her situation and connected with the O.U.R. Aftercare Team. She is now safe and the trafficker was arrested. Recently the O.U.R. Aftercare Team celebrated Madeline’s 18th birthday with her and her mother. They also provided follow-up care, set up therapy sessions with a psychologist at our partnering aftercare home, and prepared her to start veterinarian school! After the celebration her mom said to our team, “She is happy, I wouldn’t trade you all for anything.”

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: Two girls in South Asia were rescued from separate exploitative situations and placed in the care of one of our aftercare partners.  Seven-year-old "Iniya" was sexually exploited by a man in her village who promised her treats. Our aftercare partner learned of her situation and quickly ensured she received proper medical care. The man is now behind bars, and Iniya is living at our partner’s aftercare home, where she receives regular counseling from a trained counselor. She is... also engaging in a variety of recreational activities and tutoring sessions as part of her healing process. Iniya is coloring in the photo below!  "Salmee", age 17, left her village for the city to receive an education. She began working at a hotel to provide for herself. The hotel owner forced her to engage in sexual acts with patrons to boost business. With the help of local police, Salmee was rescued and taken to the same aftercare home, where she is receiving the support she needs. She is participating in non-formal classes to prepare her to continue her education. Iniya and Salmee are two of the 16 girls currently staying at this facility. When O.U.R. partners with an aftercare home, we ensure all survivors, not just those we helped rescue, receive the highest quality care.

name: Operation Underground Railroad
content: With an army of over 50,600 registered O.U.R. Volunteers across the world, we can spread awareness about human trafficking far and wide! We need you! Register as an O.U.R. Volunteer today: http://bit.ly/2LPUel2

name: Out of Darkness
content: We lament. We grieve. We pray. On March 16, 2021, 8 people of immeasurable value lost their lives in targeted attacks at 3 massage spas in the Atlanta area. 6 of the 8 victims were members of the Asian community. 7 of the 8 victims were women. We lament the loss of life and we grieve with individuals who are both in and out of the sex industry, and with the Asian American Pacific Islander (AAPI) community over this violence. This is a moment to lean in, listen, lament, and le...arn. Most importantly, it’s a moment to pray. We invite you to join us for an outdoor prayer gathering on Friday, March 19, 2021 at 7:30pm. This gathering is in partnership with our friends at OneRace, and several Atlanta area ministries, including anti-trafficking partners and churches.  We are gathering for 3 reasons: 1.          Lament the lives that were lost and declare that they were precious, seen, and valued. 2.         Pray for the families of the victims, survivors of the sex industry, the AAPI community, the suspect, and our nation. 3.         Stand in solidarity and love against gender-based and racialized violence. ***COVID protocols will be observed.  1 Corinthians 12:25-26 …so that there should be no division in the body, but that its members should have mutual concern for one another. If one part suffers, every part suffers with it; if one part is honored, every part rejoices with it.

name: Out of Darkness
content: This article does a really good job of laying out how sexual exploitation and race intersected in the Atlanta massage parlor shootings... https://www.cnn.com/…/asian-women-misogyny-spa-s…/index.html

Stay tuned for expansion updates, and know that you can continue to give to this effort through the dropdown menu on the Frontline Response donation page! And as always, join us in prayer for those that are currently in search of hope across our nation.  #hopeiscoming #betheonetoignite

It is a blessing to meet so many amazing women through our work - we celebrate each and every one of you! . . . #outofdarkness #frontlines #internationalwomensday

content: As we continue to celebrate Black History Month, we want to honor and recognize Sayuri Smith-Timmons, CPS. Sayuri is making history and impacting survivors of commercial sexual exploitation. She is an author, speaker, life coach, peer-support specialist, wife and mother.  We are honored to have her as part of the Out of Darkness team. Go check out her books on Amazon! Sayuri Smith  . . . #blackhistorymonth #outofdarkness #endsextrafficking

name: Out of Darkness

name: Polaris
content: Don't miss a single update on what you can do to help fight human trafficking and support #humantrafficking victims and survivors. Sign up now:

name: Polaris
content: Traffickers prey on their victims' vulnerabilities. Here are some of the most common labor trafficking risk factors and vulnerabilities the U.S. National Human Trafficking Hotline saw in 2019. More statistics can be found at https://polarisproject.org/2019-us-national-human-traffick…/.

name: Polaris
content: Virginia recently passed a Domestic Workers Bill of Rights. Great news for more than 60,000 nannies, cleaners, and home health care workers, who will have their labor rights protected. Congratulations to @domesticworkers and many other advocates!

name: Polaris
content: The National Human Trafficking Hotline provides victims and survivors of human trafficking with vital support and options to get help and stay safe. Our state spotlight reports, based on communications made to the Trafficking Hotline in 2019, were created to shed some light on trafficking in each state. Visit our statistics page to learn more about what we've seen from Maine and other states. https://polarisproject.org/2019-us-national-human-traffick…/

name: Polaris
content: Eric Harris is a consultant and field expert in the area of human trafficking, lending his expertise to several anti-trafficking organizations, task forces, and coalitions. Eric's submission to the Survivor Gallery is a narrative of his experience as a survivor, an excerpt from one of the presentations he provides on human trafficking from a male survivor’s perspective. https://polarisproject.org/survivor-gallery-eric-harris/

name: Polaris
content: In light of the tragic shootings in Atlanta, Catherine Chen, CEO of Polaris, discusses the exploitation of Asian women in the U.S. "This entire idea that you can reduce Asian women down to their sexuality that can be purchased, that is what’s behind the idea of an Asian massage parlor. We use the term 'illicit massage business' because what we’re trying to get at is that, in so many cases, ultimately this is someone who is profiting off of the exploitation of women. And they run them as legitimate businesses." via USA TODAY

name: Polaris
content: Through an analysis of over 32,000 cases of human trafficking, Polaris's research team was able to develop a classification system identifying 25 types of human trafficking in the United States - each with its own business model, recruitment methods, trafficker and victim profiles, and methods of control.

name: Polaris
content: We are excited to announce the creation of the National Survivor Study. An effort to ensure that the anti trafficking movement has the insight needed to create, support, and implement effective strategies to prevent human trafficking and support survivors. In our latest blog, learn more about how survivors and other stakeholders will shape the study and then respond to it.

name: Polaris
content: From the outside, it’s easy to tell ourselves we would never have been lured in by a trafficker who pretended to love us. But grooming - a methodical process of emotional manipulation - is time-tested and devastatingly effective. Learn more about how it works so you can spot it and protect yourself and those you care about.

name: Polaris
content: Want to have a lasting impact on the lives of victims and survivors of human trafficking? Sign up to make a recurring donation! Your consistent support of Polaris means we can continue to serve the nearly 25 million trafficking victims worldwide and develop long-term solutions to eradicate this crime. https://bit.ly/2Rf7SP4

name: Polaris
content: #MythMonday - The most pervasive myth about human trafficking is that it often involves kidnapping or physically forcing someone into a situation. The reality is that most traffickers use psychological means such as tricking, defrauding, manipulating or threatening victims into providing commercial sex or labor.  https://polarisproject.org/myths-facts-and-statistics/

name: Polaris
content: It is vital that nannies, house cleaners, home health aides who help busy families manage their lives get the proper payment and protection that they deserve. Tell Congress to protect these domestic workers from #humantrafficking and exploitation. Act now:

name: Polaris
content: What do we know about how #humantrafficking works? In some cases, traffickers trick, defraud or physically force victims into selling sex. In others, victims are lied to, assaulted, threatened or manipulated into working under inhumane, illegal or otherwise unacceptable conditions. Learn more:

name: Polaris
content: Educate your community about the U.S. National Human Trafficking Hotline in English, Spanish, and 21 other languages with downloadable flyers. https://humantraffickinghotline.org/…/downloadable-resources.

name: Polaris
content: The National Human Trafficking Hotline provides victims and survivors of human trafficking with vital support and options to get help and stay safe. Our state spotlight reports, based on communications made to the Trafficking Hotline in 2019, were created to shed some light on trafficking in each state. Visit our statistics page to learn more about what we've seen from Iowa and other states. https://polarisproject.org/2019-us-national-human-traffick…/

name: Polaris
content: Have you seen the amazing work of the survivor community in our Survivor Gallery?  We know that the survivor professionals who choose to work in the anti-trafficking field are the true experts and the engine of innovation in the anti-human trafficking movement. But we also know that there are many survivors who don’t choose anti-trafficking work. They are teachers and parents, artists and writers, doctors and lawyers and so much more. They are fierce, resilient, talented and diverse.

name: Polaris
content: #WednesdayWisdom - Domestic workers include nannies, housekeepers, and home health aides who are especially vulnerable to labor trafficking. Their work conditions leave them physically isolated—and they are excluded from laws that protect other workers’ rights. Polaris and the National Domestic Workers Alliance (NDWA) are drawing attention to the complex world of domestic work and labor trafficking.

name: Polaris
content: Research suggests that, despite social and physical isolation, the majority of trafficking survivors have come into contact with a healthcare professional. New core competencies, developed by a committee of health professionals on behalf of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, seek to improve the health sector's response to human trafficking.

name: Polaris
content: In 2020, hits to the Global Modern Slavery Directory (GMSD) experienced a 67% increase over the previous year. Learn more about the GMSD's impact in 2020 and the plans for improvements in 2021 in our latest blog post.

name: Project Rescue
content: Did you know that: UNICEF estimates that two million children are forced, sold, abducted, or coerced into the commercial sex trade annually. We can help put a stop to this… Three things you can do right now to help directly support survivors of sexual exploitation and trafficking!   1️⃣ Pray with us, the power of prayer is unbeatable, especially when we come together to pray.  2️⃣ Visit the store link in our bio and purchase items made by the resilient women in our vocational training programs!  3️⃣ Click the donate button in our bio and become a partner in restoring hope and dignity to the survivors we serve.  #HopeStartsHere #ProjectRescue

name: Project Rescue
content: Abandoned, homeless, and often without enough to eat, Kasha believed she was useless and that her life meant nothing. At age six, Kasha did not want to live. She began calling out to God, she had so many questions. How could He allow her to live like this? What was her purpose? She would often plead, “God, please take me; I do not want to be here.” That is when our team met her. Soon after, Kasha came to live at our aftercare home for children where she found something she ne...ver expected. A new family surrounded her with love and introduced her to the unconditional love of God. Kasha has grown up with her new Project Rescue family, excelled in her studies, and recently completed her bachelor’s degree.  Kasha now helps in the same home she joined as a child as a leader, sharing the love and hope that she desired as a child. She knows the truth; she is not useless, she is a treasured daughter of God, fulfilling His good purposes.#ProjectRescue #HopeStartsHere

name: Project Rescue
content: We’re committed to reaching as many women and children trapped in sexual slavery as possible to help them start the journey of healing and finding a new beginning. You can help support survivors as they find healing and restoration by visiting the store link (projectrescue.com/store) and purchasing items they have made as part of their vocational training. #projectrescue #HopeStartsHere

name: Project Rescue
content: Last year, the sudden closure of schools and businesses, due to the pandemic, brought up an urgent need to provide the women and children we serve with better access to technology. Now with the additional technology like computers, tablets, and mobile devices our partners have been able to quickly adapt to the changing needs as government restrictions continue to change while continuing to give the survivors we serve access to education, training, services,  the Bible, and the ability to hear dynamic teachings in their own language. #ProjectRescue #HopeStartsHere

name: Project Rescue
content: Education plays a central role in keeping children off the streets and away from traffickers. In addition to providing the children we serve with access to schooling, a key program in Project Rescue safe homes is education centers where children of all ages can access computers and homework help as they prepare for their future.  With programs like these, young children who have been rescued from sexual exploitation are able to learn and grow in a safe environment–a crucial step in breaking the cycle of poverty and exploitation! #ProjectRescue #HopeStartsHere

name: Project Rescue
content: Mariana had recently escaped her traffickers when she approached Project Rescue staff members with tears in her eyes. She explained that she had been trafficked into prostitution and even though she had escaped, the horrors she experienced weren’t as easy to leave behind.  • • Like many survivors, she suffered from post-traumatic stress. This made daily life difficult, but after joining the Project Rescue safe home, she began to heal and make a new beginning for her life.  •... • Today, Mariana is pursuing her dream of becoming an esthetician. In addition to her work as an esthetician, she has also begun working part-time at the same Project Rescue safe home, encouraging and mentoring women who are just starting their road to restoration. Mariana has big dreams and one day plans to start her own business and provide employment and training to other women who have been rescued from sexual exploitation. #ProjectRescue #HopeStartsHere #HumanTraffickingAwareness

name: Project Rescue
content: Amy’s story: Amy was offered a job in Europe, but  when she arrived she found out it was a trick. Instead of working as a nanny she was forced to work in prostitution. She wanted out, but Amy’s traffickers told her that if she didn’t do what they told her to do, her and her family would be harmed.  When our Project Rescue team members met her she was scared and had no hope for ever escaping the horrors she was forced into.   But with the help of Project Rescue, Amy did escape..., and soon moved into a safe home! Today, she is more than a conqueror. Amy has overcome fear, the pain of her past, and now she is happy and is filled with hope for her future. Amy is now working in the safe home and spends her time helping women who come into the home who are in the same situation she once was.  You can help support survivors like Amy as they find healing and restoration by visiting the store link and purchasing items they have made as a part of their vocational training. projectrescue.com/store   #HopeStartsHere #HumanTraffickingAwarenessMonth

name: Project Rescue
content: The story of Navya and Shamita:  As young girls, Navya and Shamita were rescued from sexual slavery and brought to a Project Rescue safe home in Southern Asia. Finally, free from exploitation, their lives were transformed, and they were able to grow and mature in a secure environment filled with Hope and God’s love.  Both girls desired to share the Hope they had found, and so with Project Rescue scholarships, both girls were able to attend university and earned degrees in cou...nseling and caregiving. Little did they know that soon after they began their careers the local police would request their help in a sex trafficking rescue operation.  When asked, the girls were nervous, but they wanted others to experience the same Hope and freedom they had experienced as young girls. When the day of the operation came, they were able to provide comfort and counseling for the young rescued girls. With the help of Navya and Shamita, the operation was successful and the team was able to rescue 30 young women. #HopeStartsHere #HumanTraffickingAwarenessMonth

name: Project Rescue
content: Together we are bringing Hope and freedom into some of the darkest corners of the world! Each one of us has unique skills, talents, resources, and creativity that we can use to make an impact in the world around us. Every new beginning, no matter how small it may feel, carries the Hope that helps change the lives of survivors.  You don’t have to be an expert to get started! There are three things you can do right now to help directly support survivors of sexual exploitation a...nd trafficking!  #HopeStartsHere #HumanTraffickingAwarenessMonth 1️⃣ You can pray with us, the power of prayer is unbeatable, especially when we come together to pray.  2️⃣ Visit the store link and purchase items made by the resilient women in our vocational training programs!  projectrescue.com/store  3️⃣ Click the link and become a partner in restoring hope and dignity to the survivors we serve. projectrescue.com/donate

name: Project Rescue
content: The first step out of darkness is the first step on a new journey to full restoration - Body, mind, and spirit.  • • • For almost 25 years, Project Rescue and our network of ministry partners have been on the front lines of rescuing sexually exploited women and children and walking shoulder-to-shoulder with these courageous survivors on their journey toward a new hope-filled future.#HopeStartsHere #NationalSlaveryAndTraffickingPreventionMonth

name: Project Rescue
content: This month is #NationalSlaveryAndTraffickingPreventionMonth – a month dedicated to raising awareness about the horrors of human trafficking and how you can make a difference. We will be sharing real stories of hope and practical ways that you can make a direct impact in the lives of survivors of sexual exploitation. • • • So if you or someone you know is passionate about seeing Hope restored in the lives of survivors of sexual exploitation, stay tuned and be sure to share these incredible stories of transformation.

name: Project Rescue
content: Rescue & Restore - Certificate Program Do you currently work with, or desire to serve survivors of sexual exploitation and trafficking? Project Rescue, in partnership with the Continental Theological Seminary, has developed a certification program that will equip you with best practices strategies–taken from almost 25 years in ministry–for providing faith-based, trauma-informed care to survivors of sexual exploitation. -  -... Begin the new year by equipping yourself and your team with the training needed to provide compassionate care that is effective and transformational.  - - Enroll today for the next independent study course "A Pentecostal Theology of Compassion" at projectrescue.com/training. For questions, please contact us at training@projectrescue.com

name: Project Rescue
content: With vocational training, we are able to help courageous women find a new beginning a new sustainable way to provide for themselves and their children. You can help directly support survivors of sexual exploitation by visiting projectrescue.com/store and purchasing items made by the resilient women in our vocational training programs!

name: Project Rescue
content: This year has been full of unexpected moments, leaving many of us unsure of what the next day holds. In the midst of these uncertain times, we've seen a silver lining and have committed to staying ready–using every resource available to us to rescue and restore survivors of sexual exploitation.  • Every day, we continue to see lives transformed and Hope restored. It is an honor to walk shoulder-to-shoulder with these courageous survivors on their journey toward a new Hope-filled future! • You can help make a difference in the life of a survivor during #GivingTuesday–visit projectrescue.com/donate to be a part of restoring hope and dignity to the survivors we serve!

name: Project Rescue
content: In the midst of uncertainty, we have experienced the greatest ministry opportunity we’ve ever seen. From emergency feeding programs to scaling up vocational training for the women we serve, 2020 has come with a silver lining as we witness countless survivors of sexual exploitation take courageous steps away from darkness and toward a new beginning, a future filled with Hope, and our work is not done!   • Join us on #GivingTuesday to hear an update on how Project Rescue is responding to the global health crisis in the areas we serve in.

name: Project Rescue
content: Tia was only 14 years old when she was sold into sexual slavery and trafficked around many cities across Asia.  • • When COVID hit, she was temporarily released by her trafficker–after almost a decade in slavery–with no food, no money, and no place to call home. •... • She reached out to our ministry partner for help, and joined our Project Rescue vocational training program where she is now learning how to sew masks and other clothing items.  • • In her own words “I have found my place, I have found my God. I will never go back!” • • • During this unprecedented time the need is great, and we are more determined than ever to help women and children who have been sexually exploited find a new hope-filled future. With vocational training, we are able to help these courageous women find a new beginning–a new sustainable way to provide for themselves and their children. • • You can help support women, like Tia, by visiting projectrescue.com/store and purchasing items made by the resilient women in our vocational training programs! 💙🦋

name: Ratanak International
content: We're heading over to Brian's today and you're invited to join! Brian McConaghy, our Founding Director, invites you into his home via Zoom for a chance to connect over a cup of coffee! This will be a fun hour where you can join the Ratanak Community and hear from Brian and his wife Louise as they share behind-the-scenes Ratanak stories and answer your questions.  This special online event is happening TODAY at 11am PST.... You can still RSVP at: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/ratanak-online-special-at-home-… See you soon!

name: Ratanak International
content: Meet Brian and Louise McConaghy! They have huge hearts for Cambodia and love having friends over for coffee. In fact, they would love to invite you over to their home, for a virtual cup of coffee, this Saturday, March 20th at 11am (PST). Brian started Ratanak thirty years ago, and together they have seen how Ratanak has grown and impacted the country of Cambodia. Their passion for Cambodia is inspirational and still going strong thirty years later! This is a special online event where you will have the chance to get to know this wonderful couple as they share about Ratanak, answer your questions, and show us some intriguing Ratanak artifacts from around their home. This will be a fun and casual hour where we can come together as the Ratanak Community over a virtual cup of coffee!  You can RSVP at: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/ratanak-online-special-at-home-… We hope to see you there!

name: Ratanak International
content: MAPPING OUT FREEDOM Every day, hundreds of Cambodians are deported back from Thailand to Cambodia across the Thai-Cambodian border. So many men and women travel legally or illegally to Thailand in search of jobs to support their families. Within these large groups of migrants, there are unidentified survivors of human trafficking who have been exploited and who need help and support.  Unfortunately, these men and women are often not identified as trafficking survivors and sli...p through the cracks. They return home broken and empty-handed, unaware there are resources available to help them, and are at high-risk for being re-exploited.   Our Ratanak staff are working with officials from the Ministry of Social Affairs of the Cambodian Government to "Map out freedom". We're partnering together to improve the methods of identifying men and women at the border who have experienced exploitation, ensuring that they can be safely reintegrated into their home communities with access to restorative services and long-term support.   In walking with Ratanak, you are helping to improve national systems that help protect trafficking survivors long-term. With your partnership, we can make sure that trafficking survivors who need help are no longer missed or forgotten.

name: Ratanak International
content: JOIN US IN PRAYER - Freedom & healing for 6 more trafficking survivors Last week, six young women arrived at our transitional home after completing their quarantine requirements. Imagine the flood of emotions they are experiencing while meeting our staff for the first time and being introduced to their new temporary home - a place for safety and healing. Please pray that these young women will sense God's love and protection for them as they begin rebuilding their lives.  We'...ve also had six other young women from the transitional home recently return to their home communities and families. These clients will continue to receive Ratanak's support through regular home visits, support over the phone, and by connecting them with other trusted local resources. Please pray for these clients as they reunite with their loved ones and reconnect back into their home communities.

name: Ratanak International
content: JOURNEY WITH US! Would you like to join our e-mail list? We would love to stay connected with you and send you our latest updates, straight to your inbox! By subscribing, you will hear incredible stories of freedom and about our ongoing projects in Cambodia. You will also learn about how you can get involved in our upcoming events! Subscribe today at www.ratanak.org/subscribe

name: Ratanak International
content: YOU'RE INVITED OVER TO BRIAN'S HOUSE - virtually of course! Brian McConaghy, our Founding Director, would love to invite you into his home through this special online event! Join Brian for a cup of coffee as he shares some of his personal Ratanak stories, answers your questions, and shows us some unusual Ratanak artifacts from around his home. You will even have the chance to hear from Brian's amazing wife Louise. Sign-up for this fun and casual hour where you can connect wit...h the Ratanak Community, hear intriguing behind-the-scenes stories and learn more about Ratanak from the comfort of your own home. This special invite is for Saturday, March 20th at 11am PST. You can RSVP at: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/ratanak-online-special-at-home-… Ratanak staff are putting together a list of questions to surprise Brian with! You can add your questions too! Send us your question suggestions through a DM, or by emailing Catherine Torres at connect@ratanak.org. We can't wait to see you at Brian's!

name: Ratanak International
content: Today we celebrate the inherent worth and value of women all over the world. We celebrate the remarkable courage of the young women in our care- women who were once sold for a price by traffickers and endured tremendous exploitation and abuse. Against all the odds, these women fought for their lives and for their freedom and were eventually able to escape slavery. They are now bravely taking steps towards restoring their lives and pursuing their hopes and dreams.  Today and e...very day, we will continue to demonstrate our unwavering commitment to each young woman in our care. Because she is priceless. Because she is loved. Because she is worth fighting for. #IWD2021 #internationalwomensday  . . . *Stock image used to protect the identities of those in our care

name: Ratanak International
content: We are always excited to share about how the clients in our Ratanak Achievement Program and Men's Achievement Program are pursuing their dreams.  One young man has almost completed his training course in air conditioning repair and he will be ready to start a new job soon. We also had two young women complete their beauty salon skills training course recently. One of these young women has started her own beauty salon business and the other young woman is employed in a salon s...hop. The journey of restoration is different for each of the young men and women in our programs, but having ongoing support to find fulfilling and safe work is essential for their recovery and helps break the cycles of poverty and exploitation.  Our Partners in Hope monthly giving program empowers trafficking survivors with the tools and ongoing assistance they need to find promising work opportunities so they can rebuild their lives.  Learn more about becoming a Partner in Hope: www.ratanak.org/partners-in-hope

name: Ratanak International
content: You can help break the silence on human trafficking by hosting a Ratanak30 online group event! A Ratanak30 is a short and engaging workshop that sheds light on the global issue of human trafficking in 30 minutes or less! We have five Ratanak30 workshops that cover a range of topics such as an introduction to human trafficking, stories of freedom, and justice and the Bible. Each Ratanak30 workshop is just 15-20 minutes, leaving some time for discussion or Q & A. All of our Ratanak30 workshops are available for online group events. This could be for a group of friends, family, colleagues, church group or any group that you can bring together. Wherever possible, we can even provide you with a Ratanak staff member to join your group event, answer live Q & A, and facilitate conversation. All you need to do is pull together your group and we can help with the rest! For more details and workshop previews, visit our NEW Ratanak30 landing page: www.ratanak.org/ratanak30

name: Ratanak International
content: "Victims of trafficking for domestic servitude are exposed to multiple forms of exploitation and violence, including sexual, physical, and psychological abuse that is rarely seen in other forms of trafficking... Victims of this type of trafficking are usually women. The nature of the work often segregates them from wider society and they often work and live with the perpetrators of exploitation, making them particularly vulnerable. " (p.12, Global Report on Trafficking in Per...sons 2020) Young women who have been trafficked to be household servants can face extreme violence because of the invisible nature of this form of slavery. Victims are de-humanized, kept in isolation and confined to the homes where they are abused. We are pushing back against this darkness to see more victims set free from domestic slavery. Ratanak helps Cambodian survivors of domestic slavery find a way back home to Cambodia. Our compassionate staff walk alongside these young women, giving them the space to heal through trauma counselling and restorative care . We long to see every survivor of domestic slavery live in dignity and experience renewed hope. Read more of the Global Report on Trafficking in Persons 2020 at: https://loom.ly/GUw-vdk *Stock image used to protect the identities of those in our care

name: Ratanak International
content: "Let justice roll on like a river, righteousness like a never-failing stream!" Amos 5:24

name: Ratanak International
content: Today you can SHINE A LIGHT ON SLAVERY! Draw a red ❌ on your hand, take a selfie and post it to your social media to raise awareness about modern-day slavery! Tag @enditmovement and @ratanakinternational to show your support! Modern-day slavery is a massive industry that generates $150 billion each year, enslaving and abusing over 40 million people from all around the world. Ratanak works in Cambodia to combat human trafficking and exploitation. We can attest to the fact that lives are so bitterly destroyed by forced labour, forced marriage, and sexual exploitation. With your help, we see young lives being transformed from slavery to freedom. You can join us in this fight for hope, freedom and dignity by learning more at www.ratanak.org. Journey with us and get stories from Cambodia straight to your inbox - www.ratanak.org/subscribe #enditmovement #humantraffickingawareness #justice #makeanimpact #endmodernslavery #ratanakinternational *Source: International Labour Organization (ILO), Global Estimates of Modern Slavery https://loom.ly/-UcoPbc

name: Ratanak International
content: Today, February 22nd, marks Canada’s 1st National Human Trafficking Awareness Day! As you read this, there are over 40 million modern-day slaves around the world. Men, women and children who have been robbed of their freedom and exploited for the gains and profits of others. Will you take a minute today to SHARE THIS POST and raise awareness about human trafficking with your family and friends? We are so encouraged that this day is now recognized nationally to help raise awareness about the magnitude of modern-day slavery in Canada and across the world. Thank you for being a part of this fight for freedom to see hope and dignity restored in the lives of trafficking survivors. Learn more at www.ratanak.org

name: Ratanak International
content: YOUR IMPACT Through your generosity last year, 300 vulnerable families received trafficking prevention training and ongoing support. Thank you for equipping vulnerable families with the knowledge they need to protect their loved ones from traffickers. Read more about the impact of your generosity in our 2020 Annual Report/Winter Newsletter: www.ratanak.org/news

name: Ratanak International
content: Our Executive Director, Graeme Illman, shares the latest update from Cambodia. Please join us in praying for the 20 clients who have come into our care since the start of the year. We pray that they would find hope and healing in the love of Christ. Please also pray for our staff as they travel to various provinces to meet with clients and as they begin a new project with the Anti-Human Trafficking Department of the Cambodian Government at the Thailand/Cambodia border.

name: Ratanak International
content: "Human trafficking is driven by poverty, wealth and greed, but the actual issue is an issue of the human condition. It’s about us not caring for one and other and our ability as human beings to completely dehumanize other humans." This excerpt about the driving factors of human trafficking is from our Ratanak30 workshop called "An Introduction to Human Trafficking" hosted by our Founding Director, Brian McConaghy. If you have a group of friends who are interested in learning ...more about human trafficking, we would love to help connect you with the resources to facilitate an engaging online group event! All you have to do is find the group and we will help you with the rest! We have five Ratanak30 workshops that cover a range of topics on the issue of human trafficking. As a group you can come together online to watch a 15-20 minute workshop and we will have our Ratanak staff join your group event to answer live Q & A. You can email Catherine Torres at connect@ratanak.org to learn more! *Model image used

name: Ratanak International
content: YOUR IMPACT Through your generosity last year, 60 vulnerable families received COVID emergency response packages. These packages provided critical aid to trafficking survivors and at-risk families during the pandemic, easing the desperation that can lead to situations of exploitation. Thank you for partnering with us to provide this essential support during challenging times. *Stock image used to protect the identities of clients in our care.

name: Ratanak International
content: As we look back on last year, we can see that it was a year of transformations in the lives of Cambodian trafficking survivors. Young women and men have been given hope for a better future. But still, the work God has called Ratanak to in Cambodia is not easy, and it’s not finished.  The journey for trafficking survivors from slavery to freedom to restoration is often a winding and challenging one. Our dedicated Cambodian staff are tenacious in their commitment to these brave... survivors—even when their journey to recovery is complicated. I am grateful for supporters like you who are faithfully dedicated to Ratanak’s work. Through your prayers and generous gifts, you are very much a part of our team.  As I look ahead to 2021, I’m excited for the potential for even greater impact. We are embarking on some exciting new ventures this year, so stay tuned in the coming months to hear all about it!  We are grateful for your partnership. - Graeme Illman, Executive Director *Stock image used to protect the identities of clients in our care

name: Ratanak International
content: RATANAK DONOR HIGHLIGHT When Peter and Tanya heard about the abuse and human trafficking happening in Cambodia, they knew they couldn’t sit back and do nothing- so they decided to give a portion of their business’ net income to the cause. We are so grateful to Peter, Tanya, and their staff team for their generosity and commitment to seeing lives transformed in Cambodia.

name: Shared Hope International
content: Last night, we ended the Virtual Advocacy Summit, our focused advocacy effort aimed at getting the attention of Congress. It was an incredible week of unified advocacy and we hope that seeds of change have been planted, growing hope for change in our nation to protect survivors and prevent the conditions that foster child and youth sex trafficking! https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=1206896746435330

name: Shared Hope International
content: Virtual Advocacy Summit Closing Event One thing we know to be true is that when we come together to fight child and youth sex trafficking, our collective voice is powerful. That’s why we hosted the Virtual Advocacy Summit! Over the last four days we have seen tremendous connections between grassroots advocates and members of Congress Watch as we detail the progress that was made by using your voice.

name: Shared Hope International
content: Virtual Advocacy Closing Event One thing we know to be true is that when we come together to fight child and youth sex trafficking, our collective voice is powerful. That’s why we hosted the Virtual Advocacy Summit! Over the last four days we have seen tremendous connections between grassroots advocates and members of Congress Watch as we detail the progress that was made by using your voice.

If you haven’t joined us yet, there’s still time! Contact your Members of Congress in just a minute: https://act.sharedhope.org/MDrBP8q After taking action, share the campaign with your online communities now! Find pre-made tweets, captions, and images to share here: https://bit.ly/3vyRdZS

name: Shared Hope International
content: Moving Into March: History of the Report Cards In 2011, the first Shared Hope Protected Innocence Challenge report cards were issued. Looking back now, we can see the fingerprints of what was then a God idea, although at the time we really had no idea it would carry its momentum into another decade of work. Samantha Vardaman is Shared Hope's Vice President for the Institute for Justice & Advocacy. She has a long history with Shared Hope directing the Demand research in 2005, ...authoring groundbreaking reports on Domestic Minor Sex Trafficking and directing the Protected Innocence Challenge, which established a framework of laws necessary to combat sex trafficking in each state for over a decade. You will hear how the report cards began, the width and breadth of the research, and how we have accomplished something that may have seemed impossible. Pastor Richard and Jo will join with you in a time of prayer of thanksgiving for all that God has done through this His working together with us. And to ask His grace on ideas coming in the next years.

name: Shared Hope International
content: Did you know you can help educate your elected officials on the dark reality of child and youth sex trafficking in just a minute? Shared Hope International made it as easy as a few clicks or by texting SUMMIT to 52886 or by visiting: https://act.sharedhope.org/MuuszV8

name: Shared Hope International

After taking action here, https://act.sharedhope.org/MDrBP8q, make sure to invite others to take action! We’ve created tweets, captions, and images for you to share to make it easy: https://bit.ly/3vyRdZS

name: Shared Hope International
content: Join me tomorrow night on FB Live

name: Shared Hope International
content: Deadline to submit your presenter application for the 2021 JuST Conference is TONIGHT! https://www.justconference.org/just-conference-2021/

name: Shared Hope International
content: True or False: Trafficking victimization is easily identified  False: Underlying vulnerabilities can make it difficult to identify trafficking victimization.  This is why proactive legislation and law enforcement training are necessary to ensure that victims are treated as victims and not criminals.

name: Shared Hope International
content: Punishing commercially sexually exploited children and youth creates social and legal contradictions that undermine the fight against juvenile sex trafficking— further harming victims and hindering a needed shift in cultural attitudes. Learn more about what you can do to Stop the InJuSTice at: https://sharedhope.org/what-we-do/bring-justice/non-crim/

name: Shared Hope International

We'll be talking to Samantha Vardaman about the history of Shared Hope report cards. We'll also give you ways to pray and take action.  We look forward to seeing you then.

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: It’s #RedNoseDay!  Raising money for Comic Relief, funds go towards tackling important issues including homelessness, hunger, domestic abuse and mental health stigma, all of which have been impacted by the Covid-19 pandemic. More than just a charitable cause, it’s a celebration of the immense fundraising power that can be generated through laughter. STOP THE TRAFFIK is a proud supporter of Red Nose Day. Comic Relief has been a steadfast, supportive and positive partner to us ...over the years, funding projects including our ongoing #STTAman campaign.  To learn more about Red Nose Day and how you can get involved, be sure to visit: https://buff.ly/35Scj91 #ComicRelief2021 #comicrelief #UK #Fundraiser #EndHumanTrafficking #EndModernSlavery  Comic Relief: Red Nose Day

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: Today is National Child Exploitation Awareness Day. We know that children are uniquely susceptible to exploitation and that the Covid-19 pandemic is presenting new and evolved risks. To learn how to #SpotTheSigns of child exploitation, please visit: https://www.stopthetraffik.org/spot-signs-child-trafficking/  If you suspect that a child is being trafficked and believe that they are at immediate risk call 999 as a matter of urgency. Alternatively, you can report your concern via Modern Slavery Helpline on 08000 121 700.  #helpinghands #ceaday21

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: Tomorrow is #MyFreedomDay – a day-long, student-driven event to raise awareness of modern slavery with The CNN Freedom Project.  Be sure to catch our CEO Ruth Dearnley on CNN tomorrow when she discusses the future of human trafficking prevention. Until then, catch her on a past Freedom Day talk about fighting human trafficking in supply chains for the CNN Freedom Project here: https://edition.cnn.com/…/03/11/cfp-ruth-dearnley-spc-intl.… #MyFreedomDay #CNN #EndHumanTrafficking #EndModernSlavery

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: Today is Mother’s Day in the UK!  According to the annual data from the national crime agency, there has been an increase of 45% in child exploitation between 2018 and 2019. Children are criminally and sexually exploited by getting involved in drugs and gangs.  What can mothers do to prevent Human trafficking? Learn more about how to protect your child or children in your community, visit this link: https://www.stopthetraffik.org/spot-signs-child-trafficking/ for tips on how ...to #spotthesigns of child trafficking. If you suspect that a child is being trafficked and believe that they are at immediate risk call 999 as a matter of urgency. Alternatively, you can report your concern via 101 and clearly state that you believe the child is a victim of child trafficking. Or contact the Modern Slavery Helpline on 08000 121 700. #childrenexploitation #childtrafficking #criminalexploitation

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: Working with several key partners, the objective of this campaign is to let those immigrating from the Philippines for work know their working rights. From unverified recruitment agencies demanding unnecessary fees to discrepancies over pay and misinformation in contracts, our intelligence tells us Filipino’s looking for work abroad can face a unique risk of exploitation. We want to change that. For campaign updates, be sure to follow STOP THE TRAFFIK. #BagongBayani #Filipino #Campaign #TogetherWeCanSTOPTHETRAFFIK

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: This #IWD2021, as every day, we’re celebrating the incredible women in our organisation. Intelligent and driven, expressive and articulate, they’re shaping the future of human trafficking prevention. Eloise Savill is part of our Business Engagement team. We chatted to her last week about her experience working with STOP THE TRAFFIK, and this is what she had to say: “I have worked with the Business Engagement team at STOP THE TRAFFIK for over a year. During this time, I've par...tnered with various multi-sector organisations such as Costa Coffee, Whitbread and Santander UK, preventing modern slavery by improving ethical standards for employees, customers and within supply chains. As a team, we develop effective due diligence and bespoke solutions, informed by research and intelligence, to raise awareness and drive culture change. I am proud to work in partnership with women in businesses and financial institutions who are continually innovating and developing their approach to mitigating their modern slavery risk. The collective voices of female survivors, of women in the charity sector and women leading the way in business are a powerful force to achieve change, challenge norms and fight exploitation.”  To learn more about the work of the Business Engagement team, please be sure to visit: https://buff.ly/2ukKIeU #WomeninBusiness #InternationalWomensDay #IWD #EndHumanTrafficking #EndModernSlavery #TogetherWeCanSTOPTHETRAFFIK

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: There are numerous benefits to giving a charitable donation.  Donating boosts your mood and reaffirms your personal values. It can bring greater meaning to your life, and encourage generosity in others.  It also brings us one step closer to ending human trafficking. Did you know that all donations we receive go directly back into the vital prevention work we do every day? They help fund our awareness campaigns. They enable us to scale and grow. They allow us to function effic...iently as an organisation. With so much to gain, why not donate today?  https://buff.ly/2IGXhXj #TogetherWeCanSTOPTHETRAFFIK #endhumantrafficking #endmodernslavery #charity #donate

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: Our friends Choose Love are collecting old mobile phones. At STOP THE TRAFFIK, we understand more than most the importance of mobiles. Our Aman Safety campaign uses awareness videos on Facebook and Instagram to provide vital information to protect refugees and asylum seekers who might be at risk of exploitation. For many, these platforms would not be accessible without a mobile device. Digital inclusion is a human right and having access to information by phone is essential f...or refugees on the move. 99% of our target audience access our campaign by using their phone. Help us protect refugees and asylum seekers from exploitation by donating your unwanted phone to Choose Love. Your donation will not only help refugees to access important information but will also help protect them from any future risks.  Donate your unwanted phone to Choose Love now by visit: https://buff.ly/3rc1qsM To learn more about the Aman campaign visit: https://buff.ly/3reFLzV #sttaman #chooselove #humantrafficking #refugees #donation #exploitation #phone #digitalinclusion

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: In January 2021, our first Aman campaign was launched!  This groundbreaking campaign aims to provide vital information to protect refugees and asylum seekers who are travelling through Greece and Turkey from traffickers that they may encounter on the route or at the destination. #sttaman was aimed at young people seeking sanctuary in Greece who might be travelling alone and who are at higher risk of being targeted for exploitation.  To be able to reach young people travelling... from Syria, Afghanistan, Iraq, Iran and Pakistan, the campaign was launched in four languages: Arabic, Bengali, Urdu and Farsi. The campaign also targeted refugees and asylum seekers through awareness-raising videos on Facebook and Instagram. The video illustrated the story of a young boy who was targeted and exploited by traffickers. Along with the video, extra resources were provided such as approaches to spot the signs of exploitation, how to stay safe and details for local contact organisations for support.  Geo-targeting via social media allows us to reach a wider audience than would otherwise be hard to reach, or reluctant to seek help, out of fear of consequences. As our first campaign draws to a close, our initial findings show we reached 71% of the target audience in Greece – that’s 27,208 young people. We have also learned that as a result of the campaign, many young people realised that they were experiencing exploitation and contacted the listed organisations for advice and support.  Thank you to all our fantastic partner organisations working on the ground, without whom this campaign would not have been possible. To learn more about the Aman project please visit: https://www.stopthetraffik.org/aman-safety-campaign-update…/  #humantrafficking #amansafety #refugees #asylumseekers #awarenesscampaigns #geotargettingcampaigns

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: LGBTQI+ History Month ends in the UK today. Spanning the month of February, the celebration aims to increase the visibility of the community through sharing stories, history and lived experiences. Spotlighting communities that face discrimination is a key way of raising awareness about the things that affect them – and promoting their wellbeing. STOP THE TRAFFIK is a proud ally of the LGBTQI+ community. This year, as every year, we want to reiterate that nobody deserves to be... discriminated against or exploited because of their identity. As an organisation, we are committed to supporting the LGBTQI+ community – and to ending exploitation, for good. #LGBT #LGBTQI #LoveIsLove #TransLivesMatter #GayLivesMatter #QueerLivesMatter #BlackTransLivesMatter

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK

In order to optimise working hours, applicants must be based in either a UK or EU time zone. This is an exciting volunteer opportunity to work on a large-scale campaign with a fun and dynamic team. Connecting with people across the world in many languages is key to delivering vital information to keep people safe. If you are a Tagalog speaker and ...interested in helping support our work, please reach out to info@stopthetraffik.org. #Tagalogspeaker #charityvolunteer #volunteer #translator #Filipino

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: Did you know that everyone in the UK has access to Covid specific support – and that this will not affect their immigration status? Swipe through for the facts. Sharing up-to-date, accurate information on rights is one of the easiest ways of showing people there are options that don’t incur risk of exploitation.  #ModernSlaveryNews #TogetherWeCanSTOPTHETRAFFIK #endhumantrafficking #endmodernslavery #Covid #Coronavirus Source: https://buff.ly/2ZMzZtq

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: London Fashion Week started last Friday. Delivered digitally as lockdown restrictions continue in the UK, the week looks set to showcase an array of designers.  While certain aspects of the fashion industry have evolved despite the pandemic, it’s important we don’t forget this doesn’t represent the story for all. Many garment workers continue to suffer as a direct result of Covid-19. The Guardian, publishing findings from the Office of National Statistics, revealed last week ...that garment workers in the UK have the highest rate of coronavirus deaths among working women. These findings come after multiple reports that garment workers in Leicester were forced to work throughout the first lockdown, as factories remained open without adequate safety measures in place. While many Leicester based factories made changes following the first lockdown, some allegedly continued to force machinists to work in close proximity without adequate safety measures in place. Worker’s rights are human rights. And while we celebrate fashion’s ability to survive in times as trying as these, it’s important the lifeline is extended to those at the very bottom, too.  To read the article in full, visit: https://buff.ly/3pEiO7D #LabourBehindtheLabel #CleanClothesCampaign #PayYourWorkers #WorkersRights #GarmentWorkers #LondonFashionWeek #LFW2021 #labourexploitation

content: We are inspired by Black icons of #blackhistorymonth and in particular, how some fought to end Slavery. name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: People experiencing homelessness face many unique challenges. At this time of year, when the temperature in much of the Northern hemisphere drops below freezing, the likelihood of exploitation could be being exacerbated, as those looking to limit exposure or receive a hot meal put themselves in compromising positions. While there is still ongoing research into this issue, exploitation is just one of the many challenges this community faces in the winter. Not only does it weig...h heavy on physical, emotional and psychological well-being, in the midst of a pandemic, it increases the likelihood of contracting Covid-19. For further information on how to support people experiencing homelessness in your area, please visit your local authority website. #Homeless #RoughSleepers #endhomelessness #endhomelessnessnow #EndModernSlavery #coldweather

name: STOP THE TRAFFIK
content: This February marks #BlackHistoryMonth  When we think of key #AmericanAbolitionists that left a mark in shaping America today, the name of icons like Harriet Tubman comes to mind. She has made history by fighting slavery through aiding the Union during the American Civil War.  As new abolitionists inspired by such historical icons, at STOP THE TRAFFIK we share the same values of fighting against injustice and fight for a world where people are not bought or sold.  To learn more about what we do: https://www.stopthetraffik.org To learn more about Harriet Tubman’s life: https://www.biography.com/activist/harriet-tubman #endmodernslavery #endhumantrafficking  #blackhistorymonth  #thirdsectorvoices

name: The Asservo Project
content: Sex and labor trafficking are not always one or the other, it can be both. While illicit massage, health and beauty were identified in 2019 as being the highest offender, illicit activities came in at number 2, with bars, strip clubs and canitas rounding out the top 3 of industries identified. #theasservoproject #thetruthabouttrafficking
